And if you are that know-it-all....wake up and admit that you were wrong. This concludes my totally unbiased review!

Take "The Fifth Element" on face value. This is a "space opera," nothing more and nothing less. The director does not explain the science, and that is fine. I do not watch space operas for the science. I watch them for action, visual effects, a decent plot, etc.., which I believe The Fifth Element have. Some points:1) The cast and characters are part of the awesome in this movie.a) Bruce Willis - A burnt out taxi guy and military guy with a string of bad luck.b) Ian Holm - THe religious mentor and keeper of the long awaiting prophecy. c) Milla Jovovich - A newly born human savior. D) Brion James - He is a character actor and a great goofy General trying his best.E) Zeus aka Tommy 'Tiny' Lister - President of the World (coolness).F) Gary Oldman - Zorg, great name for a villain. I still add him to this even though he hated the movie. G) Chris Tucker was Chris Tucker. He acted the best, and only way he knows although the up shot is that his style was sync with the overall speed of the story and led to the uncomfortable "making love" scene (but funny), which one day I might get a question about from my child. 2) I loved this movie the colors are vibrant and pleasant to the viewers eyes which went well with the "space opera." 3) The operatic battle scene between Leeloo vs.Mangaloren and the blue alien singing. 4) Parts that were awesome: Flying Cars, Blue Blood, A big ball of evil, the demise of Luke Perry, Chinese Food delivered & made in front of you,Motherly Guilt, the name Zorg, Tricky, etc....5) I added the spoiler thing because I did not know if Luke Perry's demise was key part to the development of the plot.

Review title: One flaw to an otherwise amazing movie.
Review_body: this was an unbelievable movie with a good story and is easy to follow. Milla Jovovich is absolutely beautiful but Chris Tucker's character is probably the most annoying character in any film ever created. His massively annoying voice is topped off by his extreme stupidity and he almost made me want to turn the movie off. luckily the movie was very well written and all the other actors and actresses did a very good job. would be in my top 5 if it weren't for Ruby Rhod. i still give it 8 stars out of 10 though. Chris Tucker knocked two of them off unfortunately. He was not funny at all. Bruce Willis exhibited his great acting skills as he always does and Luc Besson is one of my favorite and he never ceases to amaze me. Gary Oldman was brilliant and continues to amaze me with his diverse acting skills, from Commissioner Gordan all the way to Drexl Spivey. There is some good comic relief to the awesome story line in the amazing action movie.

Review title: This is the greatest film and here's my tribute...
Review_body: This film is a fine example of not taking drama or sci fi to the limit where no one understands it! The story line although a little complex is great and totally original who had ever thought of a fifth element and top marks for putting Milla Jovovich in it she's great her moments of comedy are great too! Luc Besson i take my hat of to you great directing some how you manage to get sci fi, romance, comedy, fantasy, drama and action into a film and make it not just work but amaze. Every time I have watched it (over 10 now) I found some thing else to love. It has it's critics but maybe they are trying to hard and should sit back and be amazed by the excellence that just is....the fifth element.

The Fifth Element (1997, Directed by Luc Besson), set in the 23rd century, is a Cyber-Punk film bursting with hilarity, technology, electrifying music and flying cars. It ridiculously screams sci-fi, so much that it can be mistaken for a spoof, of which it certainly is not. Besson, ever the eye for detail, creates the future in a fantastically zingy way that draws the audience in to its colourful world of fast paced mingleaninga.Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) is former special agent, now taxi driver turned special agent again in order to save the world from an ever growing evil in the form of a giant burning evil 'scare the pants of The President' ball of fire. In order to save the world from this said evil he needs five elements, 4 of which are unknown to everybody except the fifth element who he predictably meets after she falls into his taxi after being chased by cops.Leeloo Minai Lekarariba Laminai Tchai Ekbat De Sebat, otherwise known as Leeloo, is the Fifth Element that predictably falls into Korben Dallas' taxi cab. She is not human, not robot, not anything really, although she is very much a human. She was built from strands of DNA to create what scientists called 'The Perfect Being', and she is really. She was built to 'Protect'. She is a likable character; her flaming orange hair accentuates her unique personality. She is the brainiest character, knows everything, and learns everything by just looking at pictures and text for just one split second, possibly due to the fact that she was made with a photographic memory.Ruby Rhod (Chris Tucker) is a squeaky voiced, over-dramatic confusing Radio DJ whose hair is really eccentric and unpredictable. He follows Korban around like a bad smell, and annoys the living daylights out of him. If it's not the plot of the film that keeps you entertained, it's Ruby. While he may seem annoying and you may think that you will hate him, I can assure you that you won't. There's just something about him that makes you want to see this film over and over again. In all the scenes he's in, he speaks in his own way, and will not shut up. Most of the time you can hear nothing but him blabbering on. He is a great character for a film like this.The film is largely dependant on its fast paced music to keep the audience enthralled, the punky pop music is extremely enjoyable and helps keep the film bouncing on its toes. In one electrifyingly gripping scene, an opera singer, known as the Diva, is singing classical opera, and then suddenly BOOM! She starts singing opera but with a punkish popish side to it, zingy waves of fast paced electric pop music flying into your awaiting ears and through your brain, instantly changing the mood of the scene. Whilst the Diva is singing, the scene cuts back and forth on time with the beat of the music between the Diva and a fight between Leeloo the Fifth Element and aliens bent on stealing the other 4 elements, the music greatly affecting the feelings happening in the fight.This film entertained me all the way through, and has burnt itself with great detail and a lot of smoke into my memory; I could never forget the colourful electric eccentric hilarious fast paced world of this film. If you ever get the chance to see this film, you should definitely watch it, you will be thoroughly amazed.

Review title: Möbius is not alone, in there.
Review_body: From watching The Fifth Element, one cannot escape the "Heavy Metal" look of the movie; the whole movie, the sets, the story, the characters have simply walked-out of a french/belgian comic book...Like so many millions of french people born in Besson's years, it was hard to grow without reading the "Tintin", "Spirou" and, most importantly, "Pilote" comic magazines ("Pilote" can rightfully claim to be the precursor to "Métal-Hurlant" (translated as "Heavy Metal").Zorg, the villain, has obviously been patterned after "Zorglub", Spirou's most notorious villain, with only a tiny remnant of his beard, though. Both want to achieve total domination, and they do so with immensely powerful means and an army of docile subordinates, but not without fumbling helplessly with technology. While Zorg's gets killed, Zorglub makes his exit on a lowly bicycle instead of one of his high-tech skycars, after grossly misspelling "Coca-Cola" on the moon.And about Korben Dallas and LeeLo, don't look towards Jean Giraud (Möbius) for inspiration. Korben is obviously inspired from Christin & Mézières' tech-savvy Valérian, while Leelo is Laureline (a sorceress [witches aren't usually beautiful] who comes into the high-tech stories through magic, and who always saves Valérian's ass when his high-technology gets overwhelmed).The Fifth Element is obviously a frenchman's satire of the americans, which are regarded as being kitsch and masters of bad-taste, yet not without a hint of admiration for New-York City, the average frenchman's idea of what America is. How better embody this better than with the überkitsch Fhlostom Paradise luxury liner? And to drive the point home even more effectively, Ruby Rhod really rubs-in the epitome of kitschness.Likewise, Besson's view of futuristic New-York is an endless superposition of clichés; the kamikaze cabbies, the towering buildings, the street violence, the cool policemen going about their business, and the zanyness of some eccentric characters not noticed by the rest of the people... But here, one will have no trouble crediting Möbius for the scenery, directly inspired from the well-cities of L'Incal.Finally, The Fifth Element is an immensely enjoyable movie, if only because of it's unconventionnal roots: the franco/belgian comic-book science-fiction school.

Possible Spoilers, but nothing major ********************* This is my favorite movie of all time. Sure the plot's been done before (good vs. evil. The rest I cannot give away)....but it's never been done like this! The over-the-top acting on all accounts makes this film a riot(Willis, Jovovich, Tucker, Oldman, and Holm, especially). The dialogue is witty and fantastically silly, but so well delivered. I'd be surprised if you didn't come out of this film with several good one-liners(ex:"cheekan...good"). The action sequences are cleverly mixed with electronic and middle eastern style music pieces that beg to be danced to. You have to be made of stone not to love the Diva's performance, which ultimately won me over on the film. There are several sequences that make prodigious use of seamless parallel cuts(also very funny). And if all this wasn't enough, there are the sets. They're like, Blade Runner and the amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat! It's a mix of old and new(cars look quite 20's, and I'm sure you notice a particular modern day fast food franchise), not to mention the costumes, which combine the best of scifi imagination with some kind of mind-altering drug. If you're looking for an intellectual commentary on future society, you're in the wrong place; but, if you just wanna laugh and have fun and give your eyes a stylist SFX treat, then strap yourself in for a ride...

Possibly the worst movie of all time.  I have no words to convey how painful it was to watch this movie.  The story was disjointed, the characters ranged from stereotypes to caricatures to offensive.  The action was comic at best, and the 'lighter' moments were so staged/forced that they only added more misery to this abomination.

No, I really was not disappointed.  The Fifth Element has it all:  drama, comedy, romance, a fast-paced plot, and great characters.  Chris Tucker is laugh-out-loud funny as the dim-witted, vain Ruby Rhod.  Gary Oldman is deliciously sinister as Zorg.  And Bruce Willis is sarcastic and gritty as our hero, Korben Dallas.  The film is set in a mind-boggling future with body rebuilding, interstellar travel, and, of course, flying cars.  The plot (to make it short: defeat the bad guy, use the weapon against evil, save the world) is quick and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  If you have the misfortune of being someone who has not seen this film, I would reccommend that you go rent it.

Imaginative, colorful, and entertaining. The plot was weak where the "Evil/Shadow" and the bad guys were concerned, but the movie contained enough new ideas to keep it fun. If you are a fan of the sci-fi genre, there is a lot to like in the film. As a sci-fi buff, I really enjoyed the imaginative scenery (luxury liners in space). It is always interesting to see how writers and directors view life in the future. The pace was fast and the action relatively believable. Bruce Willis' Korbin Dallas character was entertaining, and could anchor a series of similar films. Milla Jovovich was definitely eyecatching, and Chris Tucker was absolutely hilarious as Ruby Rhod. One thing that I enjoy about futuristic sci-fi movies is that the future is going to be anything but boring. Good job Mr. Besson, keep up the good work.

Yes, Chris Tucker's sexuality will shock the old (white) folks. Yes, Gary Oldman's over-the-top performance and bleeding forehead won't please them either. But there simply is no other movie, science-fiction or otherwise, that outranks this movie in imaginativeness or visual style. Oddly, it capture New York City in the 1990's better than any film set in the 20th Century. The story is pulp fiction and the ending maudlin; but who would have it any other way? Willis, Jovovich, Besson (for direction and script), and perhaps Tucker (and Ian Holm), all deserved Oscars for this. Perhaps some day Pedro Almodovar will make a screwball sci-fi comedy, or maybe Stanley Kubrick will come back from the grave and direct a Star Wars sequel as a dead-on comedy. Until then, if you haven't seen this film you don't know squat about movies.

Review title: Don't miss the chance to enjoy this incredibly clever comedic action film
Review_body:
Ignore the critics. They didn't get it.
Just take my word for it and give it a go. it's a marvelously clever sci-if epic. You must first suspend your disbelief, recognize it's an action movie/ space opera played for laughs, enjoy the gags and go from there.Bruce Willis (as Dallas Corbin) is charming, funny, exciting, sardonic in his best "Moonlighting " style, and all-around fantastic in this Luc Besson film. It's got so many clever bits that you really have to watch it more than once to catch them all. The editing is unreal (spaceship launch is one) and the subtle pokes at popular culture are amazing. The dialog is so clever, you'll find memorable phrasing throughout -Just Google any of these: (Guilt-inducing mom: "I never should have pushed you out!"; Tired archeologist to his assistant as the alien craft approaches with its spots on: "Aziz! Light!" ; Lilu enjoying a second helping of turkey from the INSTANT - (made from a broth cube) microwave: " Chicken GOOD!"; Dallas (Willis) to his cat as he leaves his apartment, and turns on the TV: "Don't watch it all day sweetheart. It'll rot your brain." And of course, his response to the security officer's question: "Are you human?" " No, I am a Meat Popsicle." "OK." And don't forget the boarding procedure where Lilu is thrilled with her ID: "Multi-pass, Multi-pass!" "They know darling, it's a Multipass." )
I've seen the fifth element at least a dozen times, never gets boring always entertaining. You haven't seen it, see it.

Review title: This is a Science Fiction Masterpiece - Thank you, Luc!
Review_body: WOW! Stunningly visual and mind-blowing action! If you love science fiction, action, adventure, or just imagine what kind of cool stuff the future may hold for humankind - this is a must-see film. Much like the world of Blade Runner in the way the world looks and feels in the distant future - everything you could possibly love about science fiction, action, adventure, comedy, and even romance is right here! From the moment the movie begins, you know that you are going to be in for something magical and wonderful. I grew up reading Heavy Metal Magazine and enjoyed the animated motion picture as well. This movie brought together all of the incredible art and magic of those artist into a live action film with great acting and a brilliant story. Thank you, Luc Besson (and the artists that helped you) - you have created a brilliant work of art!

Lilu, is brought from her temple, kicking and screaming by the monochewens. Unfortunately, she dies too and therefore becomes one. But she is healed by the machine after the dendongoloids (who were sent out by the evil rock planet) shoot her aircraft out of the sky and it crashes into earth. Loosely based on Frankenstein. Lilu attempts to kill herself but corben dallas comes to the rescue. She asks to visit priest victor kornelius after presenting her credit card to the taxi driver. They are all on a mission to save the world and in the end, they succeed. Meanwhile, back at the ranch, lilu has to fight off the dendongoloids who as it turns out were sent out by the evil rock planet using everything she has learnt off the computer. which is pretty much everything you would ever need to learn.

I watched it in the cinema in 1998 and several times on tv after that. And today again (30.01.21) on Estonian national tv channel, what is a quality sign itself in our country.The FE has so many layers in it. Actors do a fantastic job. I think it is one of the best berformances of Willis, Oldman and Jovovich. The movie is packed, every scene is thought through. Color and costume (Gaultier himself) language makes the movie modern, light and positive (instead of heavy and dark as many other sci fi movies). The Diva performance is hypnotizing, and ending with the elements of EDM (1997!), wich really went into main steam 20 years later.I just like the movie. In its simplissity it has very strong charactre and depth. And i still got goose pumps and also some tears. 10p!

I saw this movie so long ago. I was probably in or middle school or something. I loved it when I saw it though, and even now it remains one of my top choices. One of the few movies I could watch start to finish.It was my first encounter with the thrilling Milla Jovovich. I tell you I think she's an amazing actress! Such range. I mean if you only know her from The Fifth Element and Resident Evil you wouldn't think so, but she was also in Zoolander as Katinka and in The Messenger as Joan. Sure she doesn't really have any boobs but she's got a lot of personality, she puts a lot of strength and vulnerability to her characters. A kick a** female! That diva song is so beautiful. Touching.I think that this is such a cool take on the future too. The technology is far more advanced, but the people seem real, kind of gritty. It's like the characters are each unique. I like how you can see normal people trying to make their living. The cops at the McDonalds, the Chinese guy, Corban's small apartment with all the modern conveniences and extreme lack of space hehe.Gosh I remember when Leeloo's fight scene was up for a nomination on the MTV awards. I was watching. I voted for it. I forget the others.Bruce Willis is good. I find that in my opinion his characters are often similar, but that is my perspective. I just think of Sin City, Armageddon, and Unbreakable here. He's someone who gets stuff done. Doesn't freak out. He's the guy you call when you're in trouble. Not much for conversation, a man of few words. Calm. Hehe I liked him in Pulp Fiction too. My favorite part is where he freaks out and starts cursing "Bedside table, next to the kangaroo. i told her specifically not to forget my watch!"Somebody get Chris Tucker (Blackie Chan) some more work!

I have been watching it over and over... CGI effects in year 1997 were nice enough comparing to new movies in 2017 (20 years later!).Here in Lithuania we even had SCI-fi themed TV-show with clips taken from this movie.Great movie overall.
In the beginning I thought it was going to be insanely bad but it lead to be a great freaking movie. What can I say.. Cult? YES, Adventurous? Yes, Action? Obviously. I recommend to everyone.

I've loved this movie since it first appeared. To me, it's futuristic, fantasy and fun entertainment. I watch it whenever it's on TV. It's on today! For me, The Fifth Element counteracts the ongoing negative news and current events. It's a hoot. The actors have achieved fame in other projects and movies, but I loved them all in The Fifth Element. It's one of my favorite movies and I never tire of watching it!

This is just pure fun from start to finish. Bruce Willis when he was in his prime! It has romance, comedy, drama, action and adventure all rolled into an amazing sci fi flick. I could watch this any time every time.

Review title: Legendary film that has stood the test of time.
Review_body:
22 years later and this film is still next level compared to the best films today, even today it still plays like a new blockbuster and is excellent entertainment.
Comedy, action and sci-fi are regularly overlaid on top of each other, the volume of content this film manages to squeezes into ~120 minutes is totally amazing and waste scenes are non-existent. The comedy is actually unique and funny and it mixes well with the action. The sci-fi is great and the view of the future is still intriguing (sleeper cells in airplanes, apartments with vertical storage and reconfiguration, instant makeup devices, instant food devices, flying cars, trains that ride vertically up super tall skyscrapers, smart rifles, nuclear powered jetliners, medical devices that can reconstruct human bodies, etc). The acting is great and the characters really come across as real. The action is excellent and is greatly enriched by the previously mentioned overlays.This should really be taught as an example in film school of how to do movies right.

Review title: Die-hard attitude, Star Trek generations grandeur and comedy
Review_body: This movie is one of the best edited, best acted, facinating, funny, dramatic, excellent special effects, cool storyline, great one liner's type of adventure that my family and I can't get enough of.  It takes me away to a different land where nothing else matters, total escape from the daily drudges of life.  TRUE plain entertianment without (I think) trying to make a point. Sound track is good too-- just music from the movie-- almost in order-- seems somewhat strange, but mixed with the movie, it makes sense. And who is Luke Besson??  Awesome job!! Bravo!!

It sounds to me like people either like the movie or hate the movie; no middle of the road.  I liked it.  I know there were some unbelievable situations but nearly every movie I see has something that wouldn't happen in real life.  Besides the movie takes place in the future.  Who knows what can happen.  It's just an entertaining movie with a fabulous soundtrack. It's that simple.

This movie was stunning. The special effects were great and the story was top notch. On a basic level it was just good winning over evil, but it was great none the less. A stunning performance by Milla Jovovich and Bruce Willis. Luc Besson is one of the great action directors of the 90's. We can only hope that other Sci-Fi movies can be as good.

Finally! No more simple Men-in-black and Independence Day science-fiction. This movie has everything your fantasy has ever imagined outerspace. The aliens are very convincing and alive. The colors, machinery and sights are very creative and the clothing by Jean Paul Gaultier is extraordinary. This movie is a pleasure for the eye and very un-american. Bruce Willis is very pleasantly cliche without overdoing. This image of the future is very cynical and taken from great science-fiction books. Luc Besson has done his homework. My compliments. A fantastic movie!

Review title: Is it anything less than the greatest film in its eclectic genre?
Review_body: When I went to see The Fifth Element at the cinema I went unprepared - I was blown away! Luc Besson has created a passionate, vivid, mindblowing experience that uses emotion as one of it's main catalysts. I found the whole experience..the soundtrack, the characters, the actors, the effects, excellent, but most of all the simple message of love conquering all struck through all this adversity and technology. It left me wanting so badly to be able to be a part of something so great as this film!!   At least 11 out of 10!!

Review title: It's campy and better than Star Wars
Review_body: While I'm a big SW fan, I have found the Fifth Element far more enjoyable to watch. I think the story moves along better and the characters are vastly more entertaining to watch. As for the special effects, I was spellbounded by the vastness of the city. I didn't think the SFX overwhelmed the movie as most would say. It's a clever story, it's about love, the most powerful force in the universe. Anyone could possess it, unlike the Force of the SW triolgies.

Yesterday I saw this movie on DVD and I am still excited about it. Very spectacular and a lot of different acts. And then suddenly the opera aria. I think if people say they dont like the opera, just see the film and you love it. A great movie and I am gonna see it a lot of times. I am sure of that.

This was the best movie I have ever seen in my life. The first time I saw it, it was kind of weird, but it had a sort of charm that no other movie has come close to. After I watched it a couple of times it turned out to have a good plot, good actors and actresses(except for the president), and great special effects. I'm giving it a 10 all the way!

Alas, I have searched far and wide among 'the knowing' aka critics to find supporters of this film....was I wrong to immediately purchase the video after only one viewing?...was my favourite, STAR WARS trilogy, to fall under the stones of the four elements with no-one to support me?...are the nuances of this movie as amazing as I see them (or was it that very special dry white wine?)....NOW I KNOW....I have found the chosen at this site, those with vision, childhood glee, and a true recognition that this is just the most amazing, well-dialogued, beautifully crafted and fun.....FUN...movie in a very long time. I recommend The Fifth Element to all of my friends as a test...if they like it, on any level, they remain friends....if not.....I am very disappointed..........

Review title: Definitely One of the Decades 10 Best
Review_body: Polarization.  That's what this movie does.  People either hate it or love it.  Personally, I love it!  It has exactly what I look for in a film: Action, Comedy, Romance, Suspense and FX.  In fact, it's the reason I bought my DVD player! Sure, the plot had some holes.  I don't know of any movie that doesn't. But if you create a movie that is visually stunning, witty, and can keep you on the edge of your seat for 2 hours, then plot holes seem to disappear. I was particularly impressed with the costumes.  Very futuristic, and appropriate considering the overall look of the film.  The music is top-notch.  If you haven't purchased the sound-track, please do.  It's a great combination of orchestration, techno-style rock, urban, and classical. Most everyone I know who has seen the movie loves it.  There are always exceptions, but overall, you do not have to be a sci-fi fanatic to appreciate The Fifth Element.

Review title: a futuristic rollercoaster ride through spectacular visuals
Review_body: Excellent costuming. Visual effects are spectacular with a cast of characters that develop quickly and lead you through a non-stop tour of Luc Besson's vision of the future. Eric Serra's music score is powerful and dynamic which accentuates and reinforces the movie's overall look and feel. Great role for Milla Jovovich who takes on the cartoon character of LeeLoo and brings it to life. The diva/fight scene is a cinema event that is second to none. It alone is worth the price of admission.

Review title: The more I watched it, the more I liked it.
Review_body: When I first saw the previews of the movie in the theatre, I thought it would be lame.  The "teaser" was very vague and gave me the impression it was going to be one of those "Dark & Evil" movies that I hate.  ("The Crow", for instance.)  The regular "theatrical" trailer wasn't much better but it got my interest up.The movie itself was good the first time I saw it but a little hard to understand because of the way some parts were edited.  The intercut parts in particular were hard to follow. (The fight/concert scene for example)The next time I saw it, I thought those were the best scenes.The special effects are great.The social commentary about life in the future was rather entertaining. ("Put your hands in the yellow circles!")The soundtrack is great, especially when played in digital sound (Dolby Dig. / DTS) at high volume!The story is a little bit 'basic' (A mission to save the world)but I still liked it.The characters were good in that they fit into the plot very well but some people may find them "silly" or "stupid".It's probably because they don't "get it".My rating system:* = Dumb -- Forget it.** = I would wait for it on HBO if I were you.*** = Go watch it in the theatre**** = GREAT! -- Go see it NOW!I GIVE THIS MOVIE A "***1/2"( I almost never give a "****")

I think the film was more than perfect. One of the top actors that has created his own manner in the film sector was involved with fascinating Milla Jovovich..... Of course I'm talking about our fabulous Bruce...Gary Oldman was also performing quite good with his usual evil guy role. Film, actors (Never forget Chris Tucker), scenario... everything was superb.They made a film watchable for at least 3 times for normal spectators.

Review title: On of the few movies I purchased that I actually watch often!
Review_body: The more you watch, the more you find.  Truly superb film making and great acting.  Bruce plays an every-day hero who manages to find himself in the right place at the right time over and over--and manages to pull off some superb action sequences.  Milla is great, Chris Tucker is very funny (totally makes the movie), and the rest of the cast is terrific.Rent it and enjoy!

Review title: An indisputable MASTERPIECE introducing a new era of Filmmaking
Review_body: An absolutely dazzling motion picture experience, waking the sci-fi genre from the sleeping death. The commitment made to engineer this manifesto of the epic film- genre, highly qualified for the Palme d'Or of the 1997 Cannes Film Festival. Unfortunately, the picture didn't compete at all. With "Le cinqueme element", Luc Besson and Eric Serra reached the peak of their companionship through many years- together with an almost perfect cast and crew. I've seen the film a dozen times, and it still manages to fascinate me. The score, composed by ever-so-fulfilling Eric Serra, is well thought through and enjoyable listening to- even without the motion picture to accompany it. Honors also go to Jean Paul Gaultier for State-of-the-Art costumes and hairdressing. Never seen anything like it!MAY THE FORCE BE WITH YOU, LUC!
WWWWOOOOAAAAHHHH!!!!! never have or will see better

Maybe The Fifth Element is not as good as previous Besson's films but it is still a world class movie.It is possible that you won't like it,but it's quite normal.The Fifth Element has everything that a good (OK-commercial) film should have:not the worst script,good music,special FX and especially actors.You may not agree but i think that Bruce and company really worked hard for their money.My mark is 9 since the film could be a bit better and I was quite disappointed with the ending...

Someone can think that maybe it's only a tale for a children but I think that actors were very good (especially Mila - she was 'perfect' :)) And I was very happy that 'love' was the 5th element. It's very nice:) I know that it's not real 5th element but idea was very good (especially when You watch the film with a woman :)

Review title: The Fifth Element seems to be one of those movies that you either love or hate.
Review_body: The Fifth Element seems to be one of those movies that you either love or hate. And I love it. The story itself is quite interesting, throwing a new spin of sorts on the battle between good and evil. The broad range of characters adds to the interest and story well (with the exception of The President). The visual effects (especially those of the city) and alien designs are stunning and quite creative. Chris Tucker, although annoying at times, provides quite a bit of humor later in the film. I was surprised, however, that it was not the action packed adventure that I had expected. But, I was also not disappointed by the lack of action as the story (for me) kept the film going. Most of the real action takes place in the last bit of the movie. The only real mystery is how Luke Perry managed to get a title credit for 5 minutes of screen time.

Bruce Willis is one of my favorite actors because all the movies he's been in are great.  Some examples are Armeggedon,and the Die Hard movies.  This is definitelly not a movie that would change my mind about that!!!  This is probably his best performance yet (although Armeggedon is a close tye.) with dazzling special effects, superb acting, and a great script this is my favorite movie ever!!!!

Review title: A feast for the eyes and ears
Review_body: Luc Besson's Fifth Element is definitely a feast for the eyes and ears. Whether it has to do with the wonderfully 'sloppy' sci-fi (not so shiningly perfect as US productions like Star Trek), the tongue-in-cheek humor (Gary Oldman and Chris Tucker at their best), Jean-Paul Gaultier's hilarious costumes (the policemen...) or the relaxed acting - every time one sees the movie new aspects come alive.The basic storyline - good vs. evil where a pretty couple try to save all - is treated as a given by Besson & Co., while the setting, music and imagery get all the attention they deserve. The spine-chilling opera/dance sequence in the middle of the film is just 'one of those' surprises in the movie.Bruce Willis adds another excellent title to his palmares - together with "Pulp Fiction" and "Twelve Monkeys" - and makes good for his horrible action flicks. And of course watch out for Milla Jovovich as Leeloo, who has a memorable pronounciation of the word "multipass'...Besides all of this, there is a quote which should be in the top-10 of movie history's all-time favorites (like "I'll be back" or "Here's looking at you, kid"):"Are you German?"

Review title: Fifth Element is my favorite movie of all time.
Review_body: Not only did this movie have Techno music and Milla Jovovich (wow), but a plot that I found a rare find. Unlike most action/adventure movies these days, the protagonists had the upper hand the _entire time_. Not by much, but still the upper hand. I liked that aspect of this movie alot.

Review title: . . .will be regarded as a classic, in due time . . .
Review_body: like blade runner, *the fifth element* will be regarded more kindly in retrospect.of course some of it was difficult to swallow; of course some of it was derivative of other sci-fi / fantasy classics.but this film failed to *follow the leader* of sci-fi future flicks - the precedent established by classics *blade runner* & *the road warrior* of the future as a bleak dark coloured netherworld.overpopulation? sure! pollution and destruction of basic natural resources? of course! but why do it all in black - what's the matter with a few brightly coloured gaultier fashions and *beautiful people* waiting on you at airports & fast-food restaurants?! ;)the splashy, unique visuals & luc besson's imagery counteract any so-called *weak points* of the overly familiar plot and storyline - *star wars* was once chided for the same premise & plot reasons too, you know . . .

Review title: Without a doubt, this is my Millennium movie
Review_body: I recently voted this film my "Millennium movie" after much deliberation and this is why.  Never before have I seen such a vibrant, colourful Science Fiction film that I can watch time after time with no less interest.For a start, the costumes and sets are alive with colour - something that is a startling contrast to the usual dark, almost sinister look of most Science Fiction films.  From the outlandish costumes to the well thought out alien creatures the visuals ooze style.The story, although sometimes a little shallow, is in itself a great good versus evil battle without giving you the feeling that you've seen it somewhere before.Bruce Willis carries his usual tough guy, action-man character into the film without once looking out of place - this was the one actor I thought could have ruined the feel of the movie.  Outstanding performances from Gary Oldman and Chris Tucker, along with some superb bit part appearances from the likes of Tricky and Lee Evans are just a few of the many that make up a superb cast.To me, this film will become a timeless classic - certainly one I will be watching way into the next millennium.
This is the best movie I have seen so far.  It has action, romance, sci-fi, and all that other stuff put all into one two hour film.  Luc Besson does an excellent job of directing and writing.

5th Element is one of my favorite movies.  The costumes were great, as are the sets, it's funny when it needs to be, the action was fun, and all the models playing bit parts is quite amusing.  How many other movies have an opera performance?  Aside from snooty movies about operas.  And Milla, *sigh* Milla is always a pleasure to watch.  i've watched it at least 6 times and will prolly watch it once a year until i die.

Review title: Time is not important only life's important ... exactly!
Review_body: When I first saw TFE I was blended by the pictures, the colors and the sounds. Sooner I recognized, that there is more than just the hype-sci-fi action movie. I'm not sure if the majority of viewers have really got the message of the movie. It's one of the best, for me THE BEST, movies ever. Especially the beautiful and talented Milla Jovovich and the great Bruce Willis give it a note of action, sci-fi, story line and superb humor. It deserves a 10!

This movie has become one of my all time favorites.  I'm hypnotized by it. Especially the opera scene.  I have purchased the movie and still take time to watch it when its on the cable channels.  Bruce Willis is at his best.

I was pleasantly surprised by this movie. Yes, it ripped off some elements of Star Wars, but this French take on Sci-Fi was quite refreshing. Elements of Stargate: yeah if anything with a desert in it does. See Dune and The Mummy and Lawrence of Arabia and claim the same. When most American Sci-Fi looks like the bastard son of Gene Roddenberry, this was different. Liked the sound track. Bruce took a chance, at least, and not his worst role (See Hudson Hawk if you don't believe me). It had action, humor, romance, what the hell else do you want? And Chris Tucker was outrageous! SEE Bilbo Baggins in his earlier work!

I fell in love with this movie the first time I saw it!  Beautiful Milla and handsome Bruce set the movie bolting into the future wonderfully! Amazingly written by a high school student - it truly blew me away!  The kooky humor and humorous characters are set well into the plot.  The story-line is wonderful!  The music is great - perfectly written for the film!  This truly is a blast from the future!  This movie has become my favorite movie of all time.  I will probably have to buy a new movie soon because of being worn-out from watching it over and over again!  I give it two big badda boom thumbs up!

The Fifth Element is a colorful and sparkling vision of the future. I am a huge fan of Luc Beeson's work, and this is one of his best movies. Great aliens, costumes, ships, music and actors. A roller coaster ride into the future...

This is a uniquely exquisite film for so many reasons that I'll just to have to mention them all. The way Luc Besson seemlessly threads elements of science fiction, comedy, drama, action, romance and thriller genres is of great credit to the man. Simultaneously, he sends us a strong message on the value of life and tells us a cracking story.The look of the film is also spot on, with seemless special effects that are visually stunning but blend seemlessly into the backdrop (the car chase is a must see scene from the moment leeloo steps off the ledge) . Casting, too, is excellent as Bruce Willis is one of the most talented and underrated actors in Hollywood and sparks brilliantly with Milla Jovovich and especially Chris Tucker.If you haven't seen this film, get it now. I mean right now.

I can't understand why this movie didn't get better reviews.  I've seen it several time (unusual for me) and really enjoyed each time.  It has great attention to detail, the kind of stuff that you see little subtleties when you see it again that fill out the plot more.The fight scenes great.Bill Oliver

Review title: fast paced movie, when its best
Review_body: This is a great movie. I was completely swept away. It has so much energy, and also a great sense of humor, which makes it great for multiple views. It might not have such a great story, but the music, editing, costumes, colors and action is top rate. However, your opinion of the movie may depend on how much you like (or dislike) Chris Tucker. I found him a bit annoying the first time I saw the movie, but he actually gets more and more funny. It is like one of those favorite old movies where you forget about time (and plot) and believe in the characters and their actions. I recently saw "The Big Sleep" and experienced much of the same. The story wont stand for a closer look, but what a movie. It's movie magic.

Review title: A landmark film - return of the space opera
Review_body: This film must be considered a landmark film in the same vein as Star Wars and other true space operas. My immediate impression of Fifth Element was "Cool! Somebody else remembers 'Heavy Metal'".  Luc Besson deserves much more credit for this film than he has received. Hopefully, Luc's film represents a flowering of the science fiction space opera. A wonderful companion film to Fifth Element would be a big screen treatment of 'Stranger in a Strange Land' - directed, of course, by Luc Besson himself. Wonderful, visionary film to say the least!

In 1997 Luc Besson presented the 5th Element. Its not just any Science Fiction movie. Its the SF movie of the Decade. Costumes designed by Jean-Paul Gaultier and very strange colors make the movie very strange looking. Bruce Willis and Milla Jovovich make the story alive.

With an outrageous story line, terrific characterization and a set design straight out of a Moebius comic this is one wild ride. Vastly underappreciated when released, this is a film that should be taken for what it is - tongue-in-cheek, wickedly funny and loud. Director Luc Besson seems to take great delight in twisting (Hollywood) film conventions and that's part of the charm here. Even Bruce Willis seems to have a lot of fun doing Bruce Willis.

Review title: I just don't like this, I love it!
Review_body: I must differ entirely with the other comment I read posted here... This is one of the few movies I've ever bothered to purchase -- because it's one of the few movies I can watch on a weekly basis, and still get completely wrapped up in... Cheesy? yes.  Predictable? yes.  You could even say it's formulaic... But it's beautiful!  Divinely comic performances by the actors, lines that bear repeating amongst friends in the know, and a beautiful melange of color, music, and special effects.  It's not a serious, sit-down and contemplate the moral message movie...it's an adventure with good guys, bad guys, aliens, and comic-relief-sidekicks... and it even contains the patented "Bruce-Willis-jumping-through-the-air-screaming-aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh" yell... Too much fun!

All that I have to say about this movie, is that it is the BEST movie that i have ever seen on the BIG screen, or on TV. I have watched this movie 10 times in the last week! The special effects, casting is all great. Milla Jovovich (Leeloo) plays an excellent character as the 5th element. Out of the 6,000 that were interviewed to play this part, I am glad that she got chosen :). The special effects are HUGE in this movie. I keep on wonderin', "would it ever be like this in reality?" THIS IS A MUST SEE IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN IT!!! I give it a BIG 10/10. Perfect. Just Perfect. It Mu5t Be Found

This is a great flick.  If you haven't seen it yet, shame on you! Heh.Breakdown as follows...Gary Oldman is a bad guy.  I mean BAD guy.  He has to get something.  If he does, Earth goes byebye.  Bruce Willis, cabbie, and Milla Jovovich, perfect being, have to stop him.  If they don't, see above. There are several aspects to this movie that make it, in my opinion, one of the coolest movies ever screened.  Let's start with the cast.... Bruce.  John Mclaine.  THE man from Die Hard.  'Nuff said. Milla Jovovich.  She actually learned a language invented for this movie. Someone told me she would write notes to Luc Besson in it.  Oh, did I mention she's one of the best looking women on the planet? Gary Oldman.  He had the greatest part of all.  Jean-Baptiste Emanuelle Zorg.  Is that a cool name for a bad guy or what?  He's one of those characters that no one else could play.  Pick your own example. Chris Tucker.  Ruby Rhod, inter-galactic radio host.  This guy's wardrobe is reason enough to see the movie.  Bzzzzzzzt! The soundtrack..... Eric Sera (see "Goldeneye") put the music to this one.  His score is beyond cool and compliments the film exceptionally, punctuating each scene with exactly the right tempo.  Seamless integration. I don't want to elaborate for fear of being a spoiler, but if you haven't seen this movie, you're missing the coolest vision of the future since Blade Runner.  Trust Me.

This is one of those movies that creeps up on you the more you see it. The first viewing we concentrated on the action, but second and third time left us listening to the dialog more and more.  Bruce Willis is at one of his best roles with Gary Oldman as a great co-star.  Milla Jovovich is riveting as an "Alien?".  A sleeper movie that did not get enough profs when it came out.  The DVD version is great, widescreen picture quality is excellent and the 5.1 Dolby Digital is very well done.  I wonder if a DTS version would be a little more open with the effects sounds.  Watch it on the big screen with the lights out ... great.
This was one of the best movies I have ever seen! They must have had some good acting coaches, cameras, and producers on this show.

Review title: I love this movie with my entire heart
Review_body:
It's amazing , I've watch it when u was only 13 yo and I never forgot it's name till I turn 18 and finally I find it in iran ,it was so hard to find a movie in iran specily in 2003 with ficking internet speed .
I watch thisbamazing movie every weekend and every time i'm free to do some thing that I love . I love every second of this movie and scences .... Thanks to all who made this great masterpiece ..... Thank you and love you 💋💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓💋💓

I think that this movie is ideal for people with very specific aesthetic values. It isn't a great movie: It has some plot issues, and of course the science parts are totally bogus. But once you get past these problems, this is a movie which just keeps giving a great experience. The sets, lighting and wardrobe are all amazing. The whole movie has the look of one of those high-culture fashion shows. Add in tons of great Bruce-Willis-Style action, and Chris Tucker's hilarious performance, and you have a real winner. While this is not one of the best movies in my collection, it is the most viewed movie. Aside from "The Princess Bride" and "Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back," this is the only movie that I am always excited to see. This is, however, a bit of a departure for Luc Besson, so if your favorite movies are "La Femme Nikita" and "Leon: The Professional," you may go either way on this one.

Hi, my names Jason, and I'm 18 years old. I've browsed this site for useful information for a long time now, but due to certain events I finally decided to join the site.You see, for a few years now, I had heard people talking about The Fifth Element, saying that it was pretty good. So a few months ago, I saw about the first 10 minutes of it on TV, and it really caught my attention. After that, I really wanted to see the whole movie, but kept getting distracted...So last week (last Wednsday to be exact. Thursday was my 18th birthday:)) on a spur of the moment sort of thing, I decided to swing by my local movie store and rent this movie.I watched it that night, and I was shocked. Shocked and blown away at how incredible it is. I don't quite know what it is. I realize that its just an ordinary sci-fi flick from '97, but for some reason, I cant get enough. I had it for 5 nights, and I watched it once on each of those 5 nights. By the second night, I had already searched eBay for a copy on DVD, and purchased it for $16USD. I had to return the movie last night, and now I cant wait to receive my copy in the mail so I can watch it again. I can easily see myself watching this movie at least once a week for the rest of my life :D It is my new favorite movie, and I don't see that ever changing.The characters were all so memorable. Bruce Willis was already one of my favorite actors (gotta love Die-hard, and Pulp Fiction) but his portrayal of New York cabbie Korben Dallas was incredible. Hes the only actor I know who can be so light hearted and witty, yet such a badass at the same time, ya know? Negative, I'm a meat popcicle :D, gotta love him.I'm also a huge fan of the Resident Evil game series, and after seeing Resident Evil the movie, I really disliked Milla Jovovich. But seeing this movie made me realize how wrong I was. Just because Paul W. Anderson created a crap character isn't her fault. Shes an actress, it isn't her place to understand RE. But as beautiful Leeloo, she was amazing. I cant believe how flawless she seemed speaking that divine language.Chris Tucker? Ha, who doesn't love him. As Smokey in Friday, and of course his character in Rush Hour, hes hilarious, but nothing he ever does could possibly match up to the lovable flamboyant radio star, Ruby Rhod. He has a hilariously addicting voice. I laughed at pretty much everything he said.And of course Gary Oldman, as villain Jean-Baptiste Emanuel Zorg. I've never hated a guy, yet found him so lovable at the same time. I love his accent! The guy is just the perfect villain.But it goes beyond the characters. Its a visual masterpiece. Its nearly 10 years old, and even now the effects amaze me.But it goes even deeper than that. A epic love story. Sure that part didn't fill much screen time, but it was definitely there.This movie has absolutely everything that a great film could possibly have. Its the perfect combination of comedy, drama, and action. I'm very passionate about things like this. I'm also a huge fan of Hideo Kojima's Metal Gear video game series, and until I saw The Fifth Element, no work of fiction came close to touching the wave of emotion I feel when I play those games.As i said earlier, I'm 18. And I've had many problems. I don't have much money, I have many medical problems, because of which I'm a high school drop-out, and I quite frankly had no idea what I wanted to do with my life. But seeing this film made me realize that I myself want to make movies! My only regret is that I came in so late :( This film is nearly 10 years old, and I'm just now experiencing it. Why couldn't I have seen it in '97? Now I feel so alone. I just want to be able to discuss the film with others who have the same passion.

The Fifth Element, is a beautiful movie produced by the French director Luc Besson, featuring Milla Jovovich (Leeloo) and Bruce Willis (Korban Dallas). This film is possibly my most favoured, incorporating strange musical melodies such as tech-no;opera combined and an unusual, colourful atmosphere. Endevoured with unusual creatures and characters such as Zorg, his minions and plavalaguna ,they don't follow traditional appearances of aliens and personalities making it different. This film was considered to have the highest budget of its time in 1997, with 80 million spent, and more than 250 million earned. I'm not a particular fan of Sci-Fi movies, but this is one of a kind and my favourite and will remain so to me. If you crave suspense, action, love, comedy, fantasy and modern musical touches, then you'll love this movie. A magical fantasy set in the future with a beautiful story.

Review title: Luc Besson similitude with Léon The Professionnal
Review_body: The music, when Matilda ask for help to Leon, is the same music from when Leeloo ask for help to Korben Dallas. The scene is pretty much the same too.

"The Fifth Element" was quiet the movie! The plot was complex. There was an evil in the universe, and it had to be stopped. If you can imagine trying to save the world after losing your job, and wife to be all at the same time then you can see what this film was truly about. Corbin Dallas (Bruce Willis) had just ended up losing all the security that he had in life. His wife left him, he got fired, and he had been asked to take on the biggest responsibilities.
His endeavor was one of the utmost importance. He needed to solve a puzzle while piecing himself back together along the way. The setting was one that exists 300 years in the future. His acting in the role, I thought was spot on for his current demeanor. He was rather pitiful at first as you realized that his whole life had pretty well fallen apart. A setting that many do experience in life. A dead-end job, no significate other, and the smallest apartment that I think I have ever seen. Corbin was looking for the pieces to put his life back together when all of a sudden, a pretty woman came crashing into his life.
The camera angles and slow-motion effects brought the two love birds together in what seemed like an unlikely bond immediately. The music and effects made there first meeting one to remember through the entire film. The Boom you could say. Then the plot thickened when the realization of what must be done set in. They were destined to take on the burden of saving the world, and there was no doubt that it would have be done together.
The lighting in each scene made the full effect of the movie stand out. Each scene was displayed in a future-matic format that you can only describe as being present. The props and camera angles drew you into the moments of action and adventure. Each scene encompassed the future right down to alien skin rugs on the floor of paradise. The theme of the movie really fit into each scene as it should.
In conclusion, the film was impressive and Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) fit the role perfectly. Her presence alone gave the impression of the will to succeed through the entire film. Corbin could not fail with Leeloo by his side. These two together along with the endeavor they were faced with was plenty enough to keep you guessing at each corner. This film was well done, and I think that all involved did a great job in making the story feel, look, and sound real. No disappointment in the film. Great job!

Certainly, The Fifth Element is one of the best science-fiction-films, I have ever seen. It´s not only based on spaceship-wars or anything like that, the amazing thing of this film is, that it´s really crazy: The costumes of this film, designed by Jean Gaultier, are excellent and no one of other genre-hits is able to top them. Finally, I want to say, that it´s a firework of mad (positive) ideas, and because of these facts you can excuse some weaknesses of the plot

An ancient order, corpse reconstruction, aliens and spaceships; not much more is needed for a perfect 90s sci-fi action film. Yet with all of these elements, The Fifth Element fails to stand the test of time like its other contemporary sci-fi films, such as The Matrix. We begin in a desert learning about ancient aliens who visited earth and the religious order that works to keep in contact with them, giving the overall quest of the film. Suddenly, it's 300 years in the future and our two leads Korben Dallas, Bruce Willis, and Leeloo, Milla Jovovich meet by chance of Leeloo diving off of a building and landing in Korben's taxi cab. Korben has just been introduced as a renegade, tough-as-nails, ex-military-gone-civilian, who is on the verge of losing his license due to reckless driving. Leeloo is a reconstructed alien who turns out to be a really hot woman who remains lightly dressed in the entire film but is a certifiable badass. A cast of stars, what appears to be a sizeable special effect budget, and a well-received director, it had a lot, but somehow The Fifth Element has simply not withstood the test of time. While it is averagely rated at about a C-, I feel that it is only out of the fondness of nostalgia that this movie was not lost as an action film trying too hard to be in the sci-fi genre.
The Fifth Element is perfect as a nostalgic movie, under the blurred veneer of childhood memories of the crazy colors and bizarre monsters that seemed so opposite of anything we were seeing, it could really capture your attention. Aside from Tim Burton's Mars Attacks (1996), sci-fi was colorful, but not in the eye-popping way these two were. The use of color in costuming and set creation in the film is easily imprinted in a viewer's brain just after one watch. The color pallet is striking and memorable with bold colors in contrast to the grey and dingy settings. Leeloo's bright orange hair was iconic and a lasting image that could be the only thing you need to know what movie you're watching. If the colors didn't capture you, the characters certainly will. There is Leeloo who barely speaks in a way we can understand but has the most expressive face, and the perfect tough-guy for Korben, and the pinnacle of memorable characters Ruby Rhod played by Chris Tucker. From the entrance of Ruby Rhod, the movie seems to move faster and faster exponentially. Ruby Rhod moves and speaks a hundred miles a minute and the camera position and editing mimic this. The characters and use of the camera for each actor really made them memorable and unique. When Leeloo is panicking from being inside the reconstruction tube, the camera perspective changes and we see the room through Leeloo's eyes as she is still just recovering from being 3-D printed into existence again. The camera is shaky and the image is slightly blurred, and the editing is quick cuts of similar shots in the small space, engaging our fight or flight just as Leeloo. Through this editing and camera work, the viewers are able to be immersed in a character's feelings and point of view.
While these are all wonderful, playful elements that add to the appeal of the movie, the plot and dialogue are pitiful. The theme of the movie comes down to sci-fi with hot aliens and exciting action scenes. This film is action and sex-packed, so much so that after its 126 minute flash of scenes it isn't surprising that the plot remains basic and surface level. At the end of this whirlwind adventure through space and beyond, it seems likely that you'll remember the imagery, colors, and design, but entirely forget or miss key plot points. If you can look past the poorly aged jokes and characterizations and the awkward plot, you can certainly enjoy this film at face value. It is a sci-fi movie whose lead is Bruce Willis, a man who will go on to do The Sixth Sense but ultimately be a great action star. The way Korben says Leeloo will never seem natural and it will always be awkward that Leeloo doesn't get to communicate for nearly the entire movie, but Chris Tucker as Ruby Rhod will always be fun.

Sorry, I just don't get it.  How ANYONE could enjoy this movie is beyond me, and I'm a Bruce Willis fan!  Only the 3rd movie I ever walked out on but I had better things to do (watch grass grow, change the lint filter in the dryer, etc.).  My condolences if you paid full theater prices to sit through this bomb!

Review title: First third worth watching, then turn off.
Review_body: The first third of the film is good and you think it's a decent sci-fi/action movie you'll enjoy. Then the Ruby Rhod (Chris Tucker) character is introduced and it's downhill into cliché from then on. Such a shame as the character is completely unnecessary to the plot and without his ever present shrill campness that only a teeny mind would find amusing, and then surely for only 60 seconds, the film would be much better.Plus points, Bruce Willis in laconic form, nice glimpses into the future, like the Chinese Takeaway, Milla Jovovich and Ian Holm are also well cast and add to the film.

I have seen The Fifth Element like ten times. It's funny and exiting as well as cool, and with Bruce Willis in the main role you can't go wrong. If you like Action Comedy's mixed with Sci-fi, this one is a Must Own. The plot is in the future Bruce Willis plays Corben Dallas, a Future Taxi Driver. Ok I'm not going to tell the whole story then it's no point ofseeing the movie, anyway I'll give it 11/10.

Review title: Spiffy sci-fi action pic, severely diminished by Chris Turner's degrading performance
Review_body: Willis and Jovovich get a great start on a rousing sci-fi adventure (with excellent effects). Oldman's sufficiently over-the-top villain adds to the cliché-ridden suspense... But then Chris Turner's overly limp-wristed, flamboyant performance pushes it over into cardboard silliness. When Willis tries to "protect" Turner from the bad guys' weapon blasts it feels like Clint Eastwood is sheltering a cartoon - Missy Piggy, perhaps. A tragic conclusion (the last third of the film) to what might otherwise be a Grade A-minus sci-fi thriller/adventure classic. Unfortunately, Turner's interpretation plunges the film into the C-minus zone. (What was Director Besson thinking? For a compassionate and enjoyable - even realistic - look at Male Effeminism, enjoy Nathan Lane in "The Birdcage", released the previous year.)

I know how difficult it is to read long, laborious reviews so I'll keep this brief (except it has to be 10 lines!). The film is an extraordinary feat - camp, ridiculous, lavishly over-the-top and blessed with a crazy storyline, but insanely entertaining!The characters, though entirely unbelievable, are perfectly cast and brilliantly written. From Bruce Willis' wonderful attempt at a 'low-key' performance as the textbook reluctant hero, to Chris Tucker's simply indescribable 'Ruby Rhod', laughs are more than aplenty.I challenge you to watch this and complain about its ridiculousness without saying you could easily go back and watch it again, and again... and again. Also, even if you defeat my challenge - surely you can't deny the sheer spectacle of the mind-blowing opera performance in the middle - a scene worthy of any great film.

Review title: "Spoilers" The Fifth Element, directed by Luc Besson, is a futuristic world where the fate of the world rests in the hands of two priests, a cab driver, and a divine being.
Review_body: The Fifth Element, directed by Luc Besson, is a futuristic world where the fate of the world rests in the hands of two priests, a cab driver, and a divine being. Cab driver Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) unexpectedly find himself in the middle of a race to find the only weapon that can save them-the five elements of earth, wind, fire, water, and the 5th element the divine being Leeloo (Milla Jovovich). The film starts in a sanctuary in the early 1900's in Egypt. An Earth-friendly group called the Mondoshawan land outside the sanctuary to retrieve the stones in order to keep them safe from the evil that returns every 5,000 years. The movie skips to present time when the Mondoshawan spaceship is returning the Fifth Elements to Earth during the crisis of the shadow planet advancing to destroy Earth but is destroyed by the Mangalores who are working for the ruthless Zorg (Gary Oldman). All hope was thought to be lost but a group of scientists discover traces of the Fifth Element's DNA and are able to rebuild it in a regeneration chamber. What they weren't expecting was that the Fifth Element would be the perfect specimen of a woman, Leeloo. Leeloo then escapes the lab and jumps to what you believe is her death until she falls through the roof of a cab driven by Korben Dallas. Korben Dallas helps Leeloo evade the police through a flying car police chase ending at his New York apartment. That is where their adventure begins as Leeloo has informed Korben she must find Father Vito Cornelius (Ian Holm) to save the Earth. Korben is then shocked to find that he has won the Gemini Croquette Contest that he did not enter. General Munro of the Federated Army shows up at Korben's apartment to inform him that he has been reenlisted into the Army and the contest was rigged to ensure Korben is sent to Fhloston Paradise to retrieve the four element stones from their contact, Diva Plavalaguna (Maiween Le Besco). Father Cornelius hits Korben on the head, taking Leeloo and the contest tickets in hopes of taking his place at Fhloston Paradise. Korben finds Leeloo and Father Cornelius, taking back the tickets and departing for Fhloston Paradise. Thus begins their mission to save the Earth.

Review title: I can watch it over and over again
Review_body: Rare movie I can watch over and over again. This is my most watched movie despite it isn't the best one. I watched it around 35 times. Always reminds me on childhood and cabel TV times!

this is what i wrote for my tv guide:THE FITH ELEMENT, jean-luc bessons visual masterpiece, bruce willis is cool, gary oldman is a little eccentric, ian holm is stoic, milla jovavich is crazy-sexy, tricky pops up, lee evans is funny and chris tucker is flamin brilliant, apart from all these great performances (a 		 lot of good british supporting actors too) the film 		 itself has a good story, amazing special effects it all adds up to a stunningly good film that never loses its breakneck pace and leaves me feeling all moist

Review title: The Fifth Element was a very good movie!
Review_body: I watched The Fifth Element over and over again. I thought it is a very good movie. I must say, though, it was intense. But not intensely enough. But yet, very good. Bruce does a wonderful job at acting! Hope he doesn't give up! So keep up the good and wonderful work! I not only like his acting job, but I also like his producing job. I don't have much more to say, except, Keep up the good work! My name is Ashley, by the way. I'm 16 years old and I am in the 11th grade. I also go to Herbert Hoover High School and starting to Carver. Well, I just added that to get my 10 lines in and I succeeded! Keep up the great work!Yours truly,Ashley

I find it AMAZING that there are so many comments for this film that unfortunately didn't do all that well in '97. I was a new mom when this movie was released in the U.S., so I missed it in the theaters. What a shame! But one of my friends saw it and told me that it was a must see. I had to wait another couple of years before finally catching it on cable and he was so right; I loved this film immediately.I know it's campy and silly and very illogical. But those that hold it to the standard of a drama just don't get the point. It's a joyous film with themes of love, duty and courage.The casting was superb, Milla Jovovich and Bruce Willis are a perfect match. The rest of the cast is great also; Chis Tucker and Gary Oldman are insanely funny. Oldman's funky southern accent is hilarious! All I can say is that this movie will brighten a bad day -that alone is a testament to good movie-making.

In the wonderfully sci-fi movie "The Fifth Element", Leeloo (Milla Jovovich), an alien, faces the challenge of saving the human race. She has been reconstructed from an arm of an alien's destroyed body. The alien was traveling to save Earth from enclosing danger, when it was fired upon and killed. Leeloo is the fifth element, the "ultimate weapon against evil", the only hope Earth has. On her journey, Leeloo encounters many different people. Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) becomes entangled with the mission when Leeloo literally falls into his cab. He is portrayed as a hero along with Leeloo. They need to retrieve the "stones" before the antagonist of the story, Jean-Baptiste Emanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman), gets his greasy hands on them and destroys all mankind. Leeloo goes through a very personal challenge near the end of the movie. After being shot at and attacked she realises humans have a nasty side that she doesn't understand. She looks up "war" on the internet and is horrified by the images that come up. She has been sent to Earth to protect this race that partial to destruction. She doubts her mission until Korben explains love to her and that no matter how little of it there is, love is worth protecting.I love this movie and the challenges Leeloo faces. It is humorous in it's delivery of an important message and I think it's extremely effective.

This is easily the best science fiction movie ever made. It mixes futuristic thematics with some kind of religion, action, funny scenes and of course it also features a true love-story. Old times, new times. This is one of Bruce Willis' best performances. The look in his eyes, the smile and the laughter. All this put together with one of Luc Besson's best directed movies, make for a real science-fiction masterpiece. Beautifully made. The music is great too. It sets a certain atmosphere. A good atmosphere... After all that is said there could still be said lots of things. i just wouldn't know at the moment. This is an inspiration to other movies following it. It sets new standards, and it sets 'em real high!

There is very little that I would change about this movie. It is nearly perfect. The soundtrack is dead on. The cast is incredible. Bruce is right at home in this role. Chris Tucker's funniest movie, easily. Mila is beautiful and very convincing. Gary Oldman is a great bad guy. The writing is very entertaining, the dialogue is minimal without being too pithy. Very little cheese in this one. The special effects are visually stunning without being distracting. I saw this in the theater three days after it came out with my wife and a friend and there were only two other people in the theater. I mention it to people all the time who have never even heard of it. If you haven't seen it, don't bother renting it - just save yourself the $3 and go buy it. You'll want to watch it over and over. And turn up the surround sound, trust me.

This movie has it all. Everything from a box office draw in Bruce Willis and Gary Oldman. Set and costume design is reminiscent of A list movies like Forbidden Planet as well as Saturday matinee B movies like "Plan 9 from Outer Space.
But what sets 5th Element apart from the others is Mila Jojovich's out of this worlds body that is strategically covered in a uniform fit for a Supreme Being such as her. And her improvisation of her characters language was spot on.
This is my favourite movie all the time. I fell in love with it. I watched 3 times and never get bored I am going to watch it again.

Our favourite movie. Everybody loves it, adults and kids aged 5-10, and we don't tire of watching it.  Friends love it too.  Its got a bit of everything - action, humour for kids and adults.  Not sure why it doesn't rate higher.  Great video and audio, the Diva scene is a classic for demoing home theatre systems.

Review title: The Fifth Element: A Cult Classic!
Review_body: This is one of my favorite cult classics! I have seen it millions of times and enjoy it ever time. It is marvelously silly and fun, everyone with a sense of humor should be required to watch this amazing movie! The characters are all unique and perfectly charming in this quirky film, and the effects and filming is well done, an action packed ride that never gets old!....... . ...... ......... ....... ..... ........... ........... .......... ............ ............. ............ .......... .......... ........... ....... ............................ ............ ................ ......... ............ ............ .......... .......

Review title: A wonderful action movie to see over and over again
Review_body: I think The Fifth Element is the movie I have seen the most... It is a perfect mixture of action and comedy, science-fiction, suspense and romance. Set in a not so far future, the eternal battle between good and evil is shown to us in an extravagant setting. Flying cars, aeroplanes that go at the speed of light, weird creatures and ugly aliens are only a few things that are present during this film. The story has never been seen before : Good has only one weapon to defeat evil; it is composed of four stones representing the four element (water, earth, fire and air) and a perfect creature. These five elements have to be united before the forces of evil arrive to earth. But evil has found help and the stones have disappeared. Bruce Willis (one of the best action actors of our time), Milla Jovovich, Ian Holm and Gary Oldman make the suspense even more intense. Chris Tucker is incredibly funny and ads a lot to the comic side of the film. The story is extremely imaginative and is, in my opinion, one of Luc Besson's best. I have never seen anything else like it. The costumes, designed by Jean-Paul Gaultier, are unbelievably imaginative and fun. They are a big part of the extravagance and originality of the movie. The score, by Eric Serra (one of my favourites) is simply a work of art. And last but not least, the special effects are absolutely excellent, adding to the quality of the movie. If you are looking for action and a good laugh, this is the film to see. But the actors are not the only things that make this film worth seeing. Click here

I'm not saying this is a ten but I think it was a great movie that no one bothered with so I give it a ten to bring it up. The attention to sci-fi detail is ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING and Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, and Chris Tucker were also terrific. It is an ACTION drama/comedy and some people have a hard time with that because they expect Star Wars. It isn't Star Wars. It's Shawn of the Dead meets Sci Fi, funny but serious and poignant. An attention to detail really sets a good sci-fi apart from the bad and if you watch this you will know the difference. Combine this with the Die Hard Comedy of Bruce Willis and you have a must watch movie if not one to own.

While not the most advanced sci-film, nor the most action-packed thrillride, nor the gut-busting comedy, this film provides the best entertainment value I've come across.  The direction and editing are not soon to be outclassed, and I can't recall any movie to day which gives me more enjoyment with each viewing as this.

I just don't understand why this movie could have such a good rating. The plot totally sucks, and there is nothing in the movie that makes sense. People act abnormally e.g. how in that time security obviously SUCKS, so anyone can act like Korben Dallas and get on a plane to a far off planet.I don't even want to waste anymore time writing this REVIEW. I want 1½ hours of my life back that I wasted on this movie TWICE.I guess the reason I saw it twice, was because I truly could NOT believe how much this movie really sucked. WAKE UP PEOPLE. The rating on this movie proves the below average intelligence of the human race.

Last time I watched this movie was about 10 years ago. I was a kid back then and remembered only few scenes - like the taxi chase in the beginning, the Plava Laguna show etc.. Now when I watched it again I couldn't believe how good this movie is. Clothing is kinda trashy (but in a fun way), it's full of humor, all the characters are perfect and very peculiar (Leeloo, Zorg, General Munro :D and Ruby Rhod :D:D). I even value life more after watching it. It's the part when Leeloo says that why should she even bother protecting life if we do with it what we do (accent on war and poverty). The fifth element is supposed to be ether - the perfect, creative life force that's all around us. I appreciate it more now.Great movie!

I have seen this movie about 50 times and so has my friend. It only gets better each time. Whats better then a crazy ex-marine that can use a 10 page list of ships and weapons proficiently. Not to mention Mila Jovovich is INSANELY hot. What more to ask for. Violent explosions saving the world and some real HIGH QUALITY humor.

Greetings All,Excuse me for being naive or simple...but, here's my "read" of this film. I think Besson was trying to say that there are in fact 5 elements: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water, and Leela=YouThe "Fifth Element" is humanity (both literal and figurative). So, the only way to save humanity in the literal sense is by using humanity in the figurative sense.Thanks, and remember as Bobby D. said in "Brazil": "We're all in this together."Sincerely, Brendan Ian Burke

this movie is so perfectly over-the-top. the visuals are absolutely stunning, the music is exactly what i'd hope to hear in a dazzling techno-future, the script is both funny and extremely clever... but the part that really surprised me was the... editing? i don't think i've ever actually tried to pay attention to the editing of a film, and if i catch myself doing it, it's usually a bad sign. i enjoy watching the film and noting how they tie the scenes together with sly little hints here and there. i appreciate the diva's performance scene, as it cuts between the opera hall and her suite in the hotel, both with the imagery and music/dialogue. the way these hints are placed is very well done, never cheapening the next scene.let me also note that the characters these actors developed are marvelous. i know that some people dislike Chris Tucker's "ruby rhod", but what would you expect from a radio personality in the 23rd century? of COURSE it's going to be intense. and it's not just the main characters. i mean, Bruce Willis does his standard action hero wise-guy that you'd expect, which is a good thing. Milla Jovovich is fantastic, with her fluent "divine language" and smokin' hotness. Gary Oldman, ever the chameleon, plays a great villain even if i still can't figure out WHY his character is trying to antagonize the heroes. but the smaller role players practically steal the show. the priest and his assistant are hilarious, the Chinese food guy is funny, but the best performance by anyone in the whole flick is the mugger at korben's (Willis') apartment. it's one of those quick scenes that's memorable enough to become a great inside-joke type voicemail i can leave for any of my friends to make sure they laugh when they hear it.it's a must see. buy it or just never return it to netflix.

I find this movie to be one of the best I've seen because of its originality.  Nothing about the visual effects and storyline is like any other movie I've seen.  I own the DVD and have watched it many, many times, seeing something new each time.  I can understand that this movie would not be for everyone, some people have to have things spelled out very plainly and don't like having to WATCH a movie to follow the events. While this movie does demand your attention, anyone willing to put in a little extra effort will be greatly awarded with a very funny, action filled, visually stunning, awesomely sound tracked, entertainment experience.10/10

Be patient during the opening sequences - the movie starts slowly and my kids were not slow to start moaning about the lack of pace. But once the story began to unfold (and it's not clear for a while what the story is) they were hooked.There are plenty of surprises in the movie. The plot is not very complicated, but odd characters keep popping up to bring variety.The special effects are starting to look dated, but that's not surprising given the age of the movie.Sit back and enjoy. Take it too seriously and you will be disappointed. Accept the quirks as part of its charm.

Review title: simple plot, wonderderful music, effects and filming
