Review_body:
Fundamentally it's an action movie, but it's got such great music and effects that it's easy to forget that the plot is predictable. 
Someone else commented that the performances were wooden, with which I totally disagree.  I thought each character had plenty of funny bits.

Simply awesome! So incredibly brilliant in all its details. Jean Luc Besson surpassed his other movie "perfect" movie, Nikita (the original movie, no the TV series, blah). I can't believe it's already been more than ten years, because if it were to come out today as a new release, it would raffle away all movies awards. Take any scene, and allow your eyes to wander around, look at every details and how much thought has been put into it. There are so many lines in the script that are now memorable quotes. Discontent reviewers may have failed to appreciate the breadth of erudition packed behind so many of those lines. For instance, the "Are you Germans?" quote is a relish of the pre-colonial old world on the brink of WWI, you can't grasp its cultural meaning without this sensitivity.Simply a masterpiece from a genius artist.

This is one of the worst and most insulting sci fi movies I've ever seen. The movie has no plot. It tries to me cute but miserably fails. This movie would have made more sense as a crazy comedy/sci fi satire than a movie that prents to be a sci fi movie.

The visual effects are truly breathtaking and seamlessly realised.The film portrays a detailed fantasy universe: we are given a good impression of what life is like in a spectacular futuristic city, and a sample of its diverse culture.There are scenes in the film that look like masterpieces by a great sci-fi artist.The humour is of the best kind: clever and unexpected.On the down side:There are some dodgy performances by British actors (but Gary Oldman is utterly mesmerising).If you learn the whole of human history alphabetically, you get to 'Atom bomb', 'Genocide' and 'Holocaust' (for example) long before you get to 'War'.

I saw it, I liked it, (in spite of Chris Tucker) I bought it on DVD! It's got holes in the plot you could drive a truck through but I don't think it was ever really meant to be taken seriously & it falls a long way down in my list of Bruce Willis' turkeys. Watch it, don't take it seriously, turn off the sound when Tucker's around & enjoy!Of course, I could be wrong................

Review title: boy meets girl supreme being; saves world
Review_body: The most beautiful thing about this movie is the editing. It's more a piece of music than it is a film. The intricate dance among the visuals, dialog, and music plays on the senses like a finely aged scotch. I enjoyed the plot and the dry wit throughout the film, as well. Many times it made fun of itself and its genre, while maintaining its integrity and its heart.The director and editor take the bulk of credit (although the writing, acting, costumes, etc. are all quite good, I think) for a stunning show. I have watched it again and again, and will continue to do so for many years to come. Instead of listening to a fine concert, I will often choose instead to watch this film.

The 5th Element tells a story as old as story telling. Good vs Evil, Love vs Hate. Friendly aliens have been keeping a weapon to fight evil on Earth, but in 1913 it is determined the weapon is no longer safe on Earth. 300 years later, Milla Jovovich as Leeloo, a friendly alien, meets Bruce Willis as Korben Dallas, a taxi drive at the end of his rope.
Zorg, portrayed by Gary Oldman has made a deal with an evil entity. The weapon from the beginning of the movie is his quest. He fails again and again. I believe the theme of this movie is the power of love, how it binds us, and how love can transcend time and space to smite evil and allow life to continue in the universe.
Korben takes Leeloo to Cornelius, a priest played by Ian Holm. He is a descendent of the priest from 300 years ago, and has been expecting Leeloo. The progress stalls for a bit until the weapon, four stones, is recovered. The stones and Leeloo and Korben return to the temple in Egypt where the movie started, and use love, the 5th element to beat evil. All is almost lost as Leeloo questions her purpose, about what we do with the life she is saving. Will we use it for love, or evil?
The theme is present throughout the movie. The 5th Element does not push theme in your face. It is a simple story about how love can triumph over evil. Love guides the choices of the caracters throughout the move. The Professor loves Egyptology, and the idea of fame. The priest loves the aliens and preserving his sect. Korben loves his cat.
Even the bad guy, Zorg loves what he does. He loves being evil. Again and again, throught the movie love beats hate. When Cornelius saves Zorg, he could have just walked away and let Zorg die, but he had to much love for life to let even an evil man die in front of him.
Those without love will not succeed in their goals. As long as love exists in the universe evil will never triumph. The future will be how we make it. We can allow the Zorgs of this world to channel the hate that exists out there, or we can kiss, with permission, the Leeloos of this world to let love flow.

This movie right here, is the perfect combination and example of an action-adventure-scifi-romance-drama. It has everything you could wish for. The story is great, from the beginning to the end. It starts with a humorously told, but dramatically executed intro, that pulls you in to the story. It ends in a nerve wracking outro that against all odds pulls everything together. The in-between has so many good moments of drama, comedy, and character, that once you start, you have to see it to the end. The actors are great, and they all do a great job. There's not a single bad moment amongst them. They all bring their characters alive in the best way possible. 1997 was no stranger to CGI, but still in 2019. this movie looks awesome. Honestly, the CGI is so good, that it could have been made this year. Fantastic production. This is one of the best sci-fi movies ever made, and one of my most favourite movies ever.

Review title: Fun movie with nice story line
Review_body: This movie adds in a lot of fun while keeping the storyline very tight. The transitions are great.  A lot of characters finish each other's sentences in the next scene.  While the movie is very good the first time you watch it, you notice all the small details after watching it again.  And who doesn't want to stare at Milla Jovovich for a couple of hours. :)Any fan of sci-fi will love this movie, but you don't have to be a sci-fi fan to enjoy it.  Bruce Willis is great as the hero, and Gary Oldman is probably one of the best actors today.  He transforms himself to the part. And also Ian Holm is a great supporting character for Bruce and Milla.

This film is one of my favorites but decidedly NOT because of the directing. Luc Besson had a story with a central theme in it (the emotional progress of Korben Dallas, and how the fate of the world hinges on it), but totally failed to put enough into the film to fill that theme out. The climax of the film is greatly deflated because of this.The rest of it is marvelous fun, with excellent acting from all the major characters, uniquely entertaining side characterizations, a well filled-out future society, and an understandable and involving storyline. Had Mr Besson properly set up the climactic scene, it would have been an outstanding five star winner, instead of the three and a half star light watching that it is.

Review title: This movie was ruined by Chris Tucker!
Review_body: This movie could have been pretty good if Chris Tucker had been left out of it! For some unknown reason Chris Tucker was inserted into the movie as an extremely annoying and whining radio personality who follows the hero of the movie around for a very lengthy portion of the movie. Not only is Chris Tucker not funny but he is so loud and irritating that he actually kept me from enjoying the movie every time he screamed his ridiculously bad lines. If Chris Tucker had been in the movie just briefly then the movie might have survived his terrible performance. However, since Chris Tucker was kept in the movie for so long it, his character has an enduring negative presence that subtracts a significant amount of enjoyment from the movie.

Review title: Fun film that's breathless in style and creates a sense of awe!
Review_body: Luc Besson has to be applauded. He has created a fun and interesting story that looks fantastic with breath taking visual design. This is what we need to see more in the movie industry. Too many directors play it safe, and don't push the boundaries. The classics Blade Runner and Alien gave us a darker, dirtier future. So what about the other side of the coin (or Multi-pass)? The '90's brought us too many look-alike movies with horrible plot lines, stupid science and unimpressive set design and costumes (remember Event Horizon!).If you're going to design a sci-fi film, show me something new, fresh and thought provoking. This movie has it in spades! Lots of stuff you've never seen before, like flying taxis during daylight hours, no rain but sunny skies in a future New York built hundreds of feet below street level (the ocean level dropped hundreds of feet, and the city built downward!), costumes look fantastic and sexy ( thanks to Jean Paul Gauthier) and even Milla's spoken language is freaky. And it's Sarah Brightman who sings the operetta!Even if the story isn't earth shattering, the film works well, and the chemistry between the actors is great. It's even refreshing to see Bruce shift acting gears to a more subdued tone. He's a modest hero in this film, which works fine . Overall, this film does what few sci-fi films do today, it gives you a feeling of awe and wonder at the future.

I have always loved this movie from the first time I saw it. I have I watched it probably for at least 10 times now and still would want to watch it again.All the actors were perfect for their roles and played them wonderfully, from the smallest parts to the main, nothing to take away or add.The effects are amazing for a movie that was made in 1997, I think they should have gotten an Oscar for that. I would recommend to watch it to everyone! I have seen more than a thousand movies and this is my favorite.Big Bada Boom!

Review title: Watch it with your eyes and your heart.
Review_body: Watching `The Fifth Element' made me fall in love with Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and color.  The cast, costumes, sets, score, effects, and concepts are (eye) candy too beautiful to eat.  Some would find such a situation `too sweet,' but I consider it fun, especially because I don't believe that plot was sacrificed for the visual experience.  Instead, I maintain that there is a plot, but also posit that looking to `The Fifth Element' for plot is missing the point.  The film rejoices in itself.  Within the hypercolorful universe of the film, Willis is simultaneously *funny,* sexy, and lethal, and Jovovich is *cute,* sexy, and lethal.  Take the film too seriously and you'll miss that they (especially Willis) are not.  After my recent umpteenth viewing of the film, I realized that I also love it for its editing and framing, which add to the fun comic book feel already inspired by the color and plot, but which I was only recently able to pin down with words.  Watch `The Fifth Element' for plot and you may be disappointed, but watch it with your eyes and your heart, and you will understand why it is great.
Great SF movie. Wonderful style. Crazy characters. Excellent production design. I have loved it for we years. I have watched this movie at least once a year. Love it.

Review title: Dystopian Futures make's really excellent movies..
Review_body: This movie was superb in a sense of credibility of the human interactions in this movie, related what you can do or not do in modern society, the work involving the Police, the driving of the futurist cars, or simply the design of mega cities. I like to explore the other sides of movies, not looking always for screen writing. Remember the "crib" Xs of the main actor? Absoluting real for overpopulated cities, you really don't need big apartments if you are an single guy/woman, the waist of resources today confirm's what movie message passes by. Why are people living in the street's an dying? If all of us can afford houses and shelter,the world is better place to live.Well the set's are completely amazing, very credible, with "touchable stuff"(almost no green set)..i love it, the guns..the costumes, with big detail. This movie remember 's me the 1982 "Blade Runner"( in some occasions is dark)..has the both world's. This movie is an Piece of Art! "If you touch the future,it becomes your's.."

This movie's got the chick, explosions, guns, monsters, and the best action actor of all time. Bruce, Milla, Chris, and Gary all do great... One Of The Best Movies of all time and i highly recommend it to everyone.

Review title: Possibily the best film of all time
Review_body: Without a doubt well before its time. Although it was released in 1997, it's special effects were astounding, even today. The cinematography is fantastic, the score well-played, and the acting superb. It is a excellent pretext to the Matrix, even hinting to the famous scene (come here) when the 5th element was fighting the aliens. The action sequences are not the most important parts of the film, in contrast to an unfortunate number of films that are released nowadays. The parallelism in the film is fantastic, with one scene connecting perfectly with the next. Everything works together as it should; there is simply nothing to criticize about it. Bruce Willis is a great protagonist, controlling every scene while not holding the movie back.

Review title: Fifth Ekement missing a vital element
Review_body: Usually Luc Besson can be relied upon to confuse,bewilder and frustrate but at least he can be trusted to always entertain and keep the viewer's attention....except for this much-lauded but over-hyped piece of self-indulgence.So disappointing.

Review title: An excellent film for serious fun!!! Love it. Give it a 10
Review_body: I go to films for entertainment. Chris Tucker was the one element I could have lived without in this film but 5th Element is one of my top 3 favorite films of all time (Network and Bladerunner being the other two). Though I think he is a funny Comedian his constant noise was irritating to excess and added nothing positive to this film for me. Bruce Willis was brilliant and so was Milla Jovovich who I now will watch in any film. This film was overall one happy zany surprise and it flowed well and had many surprising twists and turns. Gary Oldman was over the top and made a great villain. I give a 10 star rating to this SF film. It was that good in spite of an irritating fire element.

The FIFTH ELEMENT is on my top 10 of all time Films. I just love it. It is so original,  nothing comes close to it. Beautiful to watch. Amazing Set design, Costume design,  Amazing Cast. I can't say a bad thing about this movie!

Review title: This was a really funny movie
Review_body: I especially liked the music, and the way it was played in conjunction with the script and I particularly loved Plavalaguna's singing...it was choreographed well, and in retrospect, I can honestly say that I thoroughly enjoyed it when I saw it in a motel on HBO back in 1998...I enjoyed it so much that I bought the DVD of it and watch this continuously much to my boyfriends concern. Since I have to put ten lines of comment on this, I would also like to say that I particularly enjoyed the non-gender portrayal of Chris Tucker as Rodd...he was a scream...I am watching it now on TBS with all the commercials and I noticed that they didn't put in the moaning of the princess when Ruby Rodd was playing back her voice on his microphone.  I also didn't know that Luc Besson married Milla Jovovich in December of 1997...is that a coincidence or not? I must repeat how much I enjoyed this flight into fantasy...and Bruce Willis looked like a stud muffin too...

Review title: I can watch Leeloo & Korben loves in the same area as me
Review_body: The best film I ever seen. It's so good that I can die for it! It also have the best couple (double sens) of human in a film ever. Militza Jovovich (Leeloo) & Bruce Willis (Korben Dallas) makes the film even better then the best one. For sure - it have it's weak point, but the best with this move it that you love it the first time you see it, even the first second and you love it in the hole movie and for the endless of time. Even the dead loves it. And when I'm dead I can be a soul on earth and watch Leeloo and Korben loves, in the same area (as me as a married couple of course (even before the death take part)).Just not too good drama of all; not too good special effects ever for that time. But the best drama in the world because of Militza Jovovich & Bruce Willis make it's to a film in the soul of death.

Review title: Make time to watch the ~The Fith Element ~
Review_body: Hard to grasp it´s been almost 20 years since i first watched this movie, and i still have that VHS safetely stored, although nowadays no VHS player :ZBut fear not SCIFI fellow fans, because just 1 day ago i ordered it again on Blue Ray, just so i can watch at home with my kids :)So with that being said, i now wan´t to say a few words about the movie itself...I got hooked right at the beginning as they start telling the story about this "Fith Element" , although they do not tell to much until we get to see by ourselves what exactly the 5th element is, and even then we don´t really know...But according to me, they tell the story so nicely visually, and the sound is cool aswell + there´s that underlying humouristic tone that keeps popping up here and there, not to much of anything BUT just BAM there it is agan...One funny moment after another nicely put into what otherwise could have been just a sad one, however here i feel the sad but then also i turns into action and humour...THOUGHTS : Go see this movie asap :DWISHES : I would have like to see more being told about the different races.

Review title: One of the best movies... ever
Review_body: This is one of the best movies I own. The DVD is reference quality for home theater video and sound, and truly entertaining to boot. I never get tired of the movie and love everyone's performances, particularly Gary Oldman as Zorg. I think the special effects were ahead of its peers for the time the movie was produced. I cannot believe the relatively low rating this movie has received. It is unlike any other sci-fi/adventure/comedy movie I have seen to date. I wish they would make a sequel for it. Ah well... it would probably never be as good.Kudos to everyone involved in the creation of this fantastic yarn for a job well done. Sound, musical score, cinematography, acting, costuming, set design, special effects, etc. etc. etc.
One of the most classic sci-fi/post-apocalyptic movies. Great in every way.

Mediocre storyline, very good acting, wonderful singing voice. The Fifth Eelement keeps you riveted to the edge of your seat with action packed scenes throughout the movie while bringing a grace and elegance amidst the chaos with a singing voice equal only to Sarah Brighton. Throw in the comedic genius of Chris Tucker and the Fifth Element is everything you could possibly want in a movie. Bruce Willis is his ever charming grumpy old self. He plays that role very well. Did I mention that the Blue Lady can sing with a powerful yet wonderfully melodic voice? OK, so it's part the marvel of high tech movie making, still, what a voice.If you get what you pay for, then you definitely get your money's worth with the Fifth Element.

Review title: Great High Camp Comedy Science Fiction
Review_body: Bruce Willis and Gary Oldman were fabulous in their roles. Chris Tucker turned in an over the top screamer of a performance as DJ Ruby Rhod, the epitome of a 25th century metrosexual. Milla Jovovich was convincing and sensually charming as Leeloo the surprise core character. The rest of the cast including the background support roles were wonderful. Sets were interesting and convincing. The special effects were some of the best of the 90s. The sight gags were well combined with the action. The staging of action sequences was carried out masterfully. The element of Techno Opera was was one of the most interesting vocal performances of the decade. Highly recommended with a bottle of good wine.

Review title: Simply the most imaginative sci-fi flick ever!
Review_body: I never get tired of watching this movie. About a year ago I realized that "The Fifth Element" had become my favorite movie of all time. Which sort of surprised me as big a fan of Star Trek and James Bond that I am. My 3 year old loves this movie too. Milla just looks so incredibly good with orange hair. I've not seen her look as good in any movie since. The flight attendants look awesome with their snow-white hair as well. Maybe its all the pretty girls looking so good that makes me like it so much. Well..no, there's so much more to this film than simply pretty girls, its got wonderful plot turns, and its so imaginative...that's what I like about it. Now if I could only find my multi-pass....

i myself liked it, and if you're going to criticize something, maybe you should actually explain why you hated something, instead of just saying "I hated it". I thought it had sort of a sex appeal to it. Bruce looked pretty damn good in it too. I think that if what your saying is true, that a high-schooler wrote it, then that just makes it even better. How old are you, anyway? You must be old, not to be able to appreciate the movie for it's action and fun. Oh well, I'm done talking to you, whoever you are. Plus, it doesn't really matter what you think because obviously someone liked it enough to produce it, and for people to watch it when it came out, and still watch it today. so goodbye, grumpy.

OK, This film can be called stupid, Silly, And foolish! Still, I think It is one of the best films of the past few years. You can tell the Movie does not take itself seriously,which is better than films that try too hard. This Film is what movies are all about, Entertainment! The characters are borrowed from many Sci-Fi epics and twisted in a delicious way. The Plot has many sub plots working and is as twisted as the characters. Chris Rock as Ruby Rhod Is Hilarious, Gary Oldman is Terrific as the Villain, Bruce Willis Makes a Reluctant Hero. Milla, Ah what can we say about Milla, Child-like and Innocent, She carries the movie, What a beauty. I bought this movie and watched it many times, Pure Entertainment. I gave it an 8

There is nothing about The Fifth Element I can say, that hasn't been said already. Other than I've saw it when it premiered in theaters, own the DVD... and still enjoy watching with people who've never seen it before. :) So! I'll mention what happened in the theater. Some friends and I went to see it here in the Los Angeles area on a 70mm screen, and in full surround sound. It is one of the older and larger 70mm screens... the theater seats easily 1500 people or more.During Leeloo's resurrection scene, you could hear a pin drop the audience was so quiet. Then as the resurrection was complete and you see the unveiling as a beautiful human woman... you could hear a collective GASP from every guy in the theater! Only a second later you could hear a collective thump of every woman in the theater smacking their husbands/boyfriends/etc.!!! That is one of those film-going experiences that comes only once in a very great while. :P

Review title: The Fifth Element: Save The World Done Right
Review_body: The Fifth Element directed by Luc Besson is a movie unlike others. The classic "save the world/universe" storyline, done right. Many things are incorporated into this movie to make it every genre you could imagine. Mostly classified as a Sci-Fi, some may also say it is a comedy, action, or love movie. Luc Besson has managed to incorporate nature into the future. Many people see the future as chrome. This movie sees it as a ghetto, dirty place where greenery no longer flourishes. Fast food chains and major corporations rule, with practically no trees or natural monuments. A classic, one man, Korben Dallas, must save the future world from a certain doom and find love at the same time. The Fifth Element is a beautiful movie because of its unique presentation of a very common plot.Every save the world/universe movie we know ends and starts the same. A man or woman who is no longer part of any military or government-based program is chosen to save the world. They do not want to do it but they are the "only ones" on the earth who can do it. Of course, The Fifth Element takes this concept and uses it, but in a beautiful, never done before way. This movie uses the future with flying cars, unbelievable skyscrapers, space ships, and alien life, and shows a different take on it. These buildings, cars, and even people in major cities and not glamorous and glorified. They are worn-out, run down, and crummy. This is a more realistic interpretation of the future because of the way we are spiraling down. In this movie, Bruce Willis plays a man Korben Dallas, a simple city cab driver and ex-military man, who of course, must save the universe from a certain fatal death. He must go on a cruise ship to find these four "element stones" and use them with "the fifth element" to save the world from certain death. The antagonist, Zorg, and the protagonist, Korben, are all trying to find the stones to use them for good or to use them for evil. Korben, as well as Zorg, are one of many characters that you find make this movie what it is.Not only is the plot phenomenal, but the characters and their development with the plot as well. The characters in this movie are ones who form the plot to be what it is. I know it's the same in every movie, but for this one practically everyone plays a part. Leeloo, the love interest, is the supreme human being, or in other words, perfect. In this movie, she is first an alien of what is believed to be the divine race, and what is found of her remains becomes reconstructed in a laboratory where when she becomes "human" or looks to us what would be "normal", you find that she has bright orange hair, a thin figure, and a face with no-make up. Most people would find this unattractive, which is another reason I find this movie so beautiful. It shows true beauty in almost everything. There is another character named Ruby Rhod, who Korben is pretty much partnered up with after "winning" the contest hosted by Ruby to win the cruise tickets. Ruby is a radio show host, very popular; whom many would say is metrosexual. He cares very much about his looks and that his show goes well. I would like to think of Ruby as the comedy figure in this film. Other characters such as the priest, his assistant, and even the president all make this movie what it is and all tie it in together. Cornelius, the priest, and his assistant both play a huge role by telling the story of how the evil came to be. Zorg, who is the antagonist of the story, plays a beautiful part. His unique look and superb acting skills help this movie form. From the very beginning of the movie, he plays a very important role of telling what is going on, what he is doing, and how he's going to do it. There are so many beautiful things about this movie, from the actors and their characters, to the graphics and plot. This movie is a must see for everyone because of its wonderful rendition on a common and almost boring plot. In my opinion this movie is going to be a forever sci-fi, action classic. The Fifth Element has a great rendition on a common plot that made it what it is, which is, a beautiful movie.

The 5th Element is my favorite movie of all time. There is not one aspect of the movie that I don't like. Every detail of the movie has been carefully constructed to form the most fun and entertaining movie possible. I understand that this movie is not The Godfather and does not embody some of the values that those who deem themselves movie critics appreciate. However, a lot of hard, smart, dedicated work went into this movie and I do not think that it gets the credit it deserves. Look at the trivia section that IMDb provides for a sampling of the detail that went into this movie. It has a great plot, especially considering that all of the action takes place in one day. The soundtrack is amazing, the characters are great. And how cool is it that throughout the entire movie, the bad guy (Zorg) and the hero (Korben Dallas) never meet? And the movie was edited in an amazing way. I have seen thousands of movies from every genre and have a favorite movies list from here to Timbuktu, and The 5th Element is at the top of my list. It will always be one of my all-time favorites and it will always have a special place in my heart. It just makes me happy no matter what.

I personally own over 5,000 movies in both VHS and DVD. Even after watching all of the movies in my collection I have to say The Fifth Element is without a doubt the best movie of its kind I've seen to date. The storyline, characters, costumes, script. All of it was superb and reasonably realistic. I can see a future much like the one represented in the film, and welcome the day (even if I'm old and Gray) the future brings soomuch excitement. Great Movie!!! If a sequel could be rendered i would definitely see it, and I'm sure it would surpass if not equal the first. hopefully someday it will come to be, until then, i hope everyone would share in my opinion, if not.......watch more movies! ha-ha its the only way to truly understand the realism and optimism behind the fifth element!

I hate movies about the future. They are always dark, depressing and downright scary. But this thing is just, well, strange. I don't get it, and I don't like it. And I don't know if it's supposed to be a comedy, drama, satire, video game or what. I have no idea of what to make of this mess. Bruce Willis and Luke Perry do good work, and that's why I gave it a 3, otherwise, you can have it. I'm commenting because they are running one chapter of it on the loop at Best Buy, and I wish they would remove it ASAP. Maybe if they kept the story in the past, the archaelogical stuff...that had more human interest. The female lead has an annoying voice.

Review title: Simply the best.. Tongue in cheek, action sci-fi made in the 90's.
Review_body: Man I love this film. I was 12 when it came out at the cinema and I watched it with my Dad in Hammersmith. We both came out of there saying what a fun film it was and that is exactly what it was then. A fun film. However watching it again 15 years later, I realise it was a little bit more intricate than that. It's such an engaging, beautiful, quirky and strikingly shot sci-fi extravaganza and definitely chock full of humor and zany performances. Yet there is a deep chord struck when I saw this film again, at its core it tells a story of romance, humanity and courage. I defy audiences not to love this film - if only they could take the leap of faith to see it. Don't rely on that minority of scathing critics who panned this film - they are all pompous snobs who would rather watch art films in black and white. Yes the Fifth Element at times may have a few plot holes and hasn't perhaps the most complex of plots, but it makes up in character and style. Great acting from Willis, Oldman and Jovovich. The soundtrack is stunning, created by the brilliant Eric Serra, who worked on previous Besson films such as 'Leon' and 'Nikita'. All that's left for me to say is watch it and make up your own mind but I reckon u won't be disappointed.

Just love it!
Every single thing is done perfectly
Bravo!

I have always enjoyed Bruce Willis films and The Fifth Element ranks among my favourite films I have ever had the privilege of watching. It is a science fiction film steeped with mythology, memorable characters and action sequences that will keep you at the edge of your seats.I highly recommend watching this epic space opera and falling in love with Milla Jovovich's character combined with the gruff Bruce Willis makes an excellent duo.

This is one of the most illogical and disjointed movies I ever saw. I felt as if every 10 minute segment was directed by a different director. The story didn't make sense. If it took all of 30 seconds to solve the stone mystery, why have a 'priest guard them for thousands of years'. Surprising for a perfect being supposed to help earth, she doesn't know any of the earth languages. According to the fifth element universe entire universe is populated by Americans of 2 colors and pig headed aliens and of course a lone blue 'woman'. If all it required of the perfect 5th element is emit a bright white light? why a living being? and why so many DNA strands or whatever? All she ever did was smash a couple of walls kick half a dozen pig headed aliens and the biggest secret she carries is that she has a very powerful flashlight in her mouth. Two hours of life wasted

Review title: Futuristic quest of good versus evil
Review_body: This film is satisfying on many levels. A beautiful movie to watch with regards to both color and direction. The tasty blue-orange combination may linger in your thoughts for some time. Plenty of action but not overloaded. The futuristic metropolis is loaded with visual effects that are excellent, so you'll have to look hard to point out inconsistencies. But I'm glad the special effects stop with spaceships and scenery and do not continue with the making of the alien characters. There is a plethora of costumes and make-up, which gives the movie life. However, you can load a movie with art and still suffer by way of plot, dialog, and acting. But this is where The Fifth Element excels. The story is simply one of good versus evil but along the way there's a dose of unpredictability as far as where the good guys are headed and who they'll encounter. Just add in the sci-fi flavor and you get a tale of wonderment which doesn't let up. Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, and Ian Holm all produce the necessary passion for their deep characters and the splendid dialog. My appreciation for all of this has increased since when I first saw it at the theater in '97. There was a lot for me to process so it took me several views to fully absorb this fine experience. Action/adventure, comedy, love, and drama have been intertwined into this mesmerizing work of art for the eyes and ears. Do enjoy.

Review title: One of my favorite sci-fi movies of all time!
Review_body: I find it refreshing to see the future portrayed in a vibrant colorful way, instead of the grey, dismal apocalypse that is so typical of movies in this category. I liked this movie so much, I bought a copy of it and watched it until I knew almost every line! This is a definite must for any serious sci-fi fan, if for no other reason than to expand your exposure. Although it's difficult to point out specifically, I could sense (without being told otherwise) it was a foreign film, which is a good thing...the mass-market crap being put out here is really tiresome. The visual style, crisp plot presentation, and subtle (and not so subtle) wit make this watchable time and time again. The more times you see it, the more you get from it! Intense, without being overly violent, and witty enough to make you feel like you're not watching a children's movie, this is just a fun movie to watch.

This film is truly excellent. Perfect casting and excellent effects. Acting is without compromise and the Auria from the finale sequence is out of this world. This remains one of my favourite films and ranks along with blade runner and Lord of the rings trilogy. Respect to the producers directors cast and crew. Truly an awesome job. Total respect to the author of the story line, without doubt he has captured the heart of many thousands of people and incited logarithmically more, with his insight and imagination. This film i recommend to all film buffs, and i am sure without any doubt will be an all time best. It will always keep me firmly poised watching with intent.

My uncle invited my and my sisters to watch a movie for movie night. We ended up watching this because he recommended it and it sucked ass!! The movie was stupid. The only part I enjoyed was seeing Korbens cat. If you're looking for movies to watch for a movie night or just because you're bored, do not watch this. Also, the movie made no sense. I was SO bored , playing with my tablet and kept doing other things besides watching it. But trust me... It wasn't worth watching. I highly do not recommend this movie. P.S. my sister liked it and my other didn't but i hated it... It was boring... A lot of whack action and bad character. Just don't watch this movie lol

i love this movie. what is make this film special is the retro aspect in the movie. i just love the sci-fi seventies they have put in the film. a little stanley kubric feeling in it.great effects and humor and of course..... who doesn't fall in love with Lilo(Milla jovovich)during the film??:) this is the type of movie you can see over and over again and discover new things every time..and this is a french film by the way..you can tell by the number of English actors. the opera singer (alien)is by the way digital tweeked but who cares. its awesome opera/techno. finally and not least Eric Serra the music Composer even if the movie sucked ii would give the film a ten because of the soundtrack.

Luc Besson's The Fifth Element is an entertaining and enjoyable film. It pulls the viewer in and keeps you there to the end. Through action-packed fight scenes, a love-story that saves the world, and awkwardly entrancing villains, The Fifth Element builds a universe of destruction, mistrust, and the all-powerful male. It leaves space for depth, but creates a narrative with wonderful musical backing that is greatly enjoyable.The movie starts with an alien race, the Mondoshawans, arriving in ancient Egypt to collect 4 stones that power the only weapon capable of defeating an unspeakable evil that returns every 5,000 years. They will return when the time is right. Jump forward to the time of the attack, and the spaceship is returning to earth but is shot out of the sky. Only a hand is found that is reconstructed to create Leeloo, a humanoid whose DNA is "perfect." She runs away and falls in love with Korben Dallas, our other main character, while they fight to find the four stones so that they can save the universe with the fifth element, love. Written by Luc Besson at the age of 16, The Fifth Element was released as a film when he was 38. The story line is supported by a great cast of characters including Bruce Willis as Korben Dallas, Milla Jovovich as Leeloo, and Chris Tucker as Ruby Rhod. Korben and Leeloo work wonderfully together as the leads, although Leeloo's helplessness as a perfect being shows her as being feminine to a fault, while Korben is overly masculine. She only shows strength in one fight scene between her and a group of Mangalores, an alien race hired to find the stones, at the end of which, she goes right back to being helpless and requiring the help of Korben. Chris Tucker shows a hyper effeminate male, whose only purpose is comedic relief while being over- sexualized and helpless. The main villain (with a face), Zorg, is played by Gary Oldman. He is a pleasure seeking sociopath bent on universal destruction, but he is comedic in his own right. The soundtrack, composed by Éric Serra builds up and adds depth to the film. The majority of the film has music in the background and this in no way takes away from it. The strongest moment, the "Diva Dance Opera," was not composed by Serra, but combined with the dancing blue alien and the Leeloo's intense fight scene, it creates a perfect moment of music and film. Although it may not have created a soundtrack that I would purchase to listen to at home, for the film, it was ideal.Overall, The Fifth Element is a great blockbuster. Action-packed, with comedic and entrancing characters, not to mention great costumes, it sets itself up to be enjoyed. If you're looking for an enjoyable evening to sit back, laugh, and go to a different world, I'd recommend sitting down and watching this film.

Review title: I Like it But There Are Some Flaws
Review_body: This is a movie I really enjoy watching. It's interesting, visually stimulating, and fun. It's well acted and for the most part, well scripted. The are only two things that really bothered me. The first would be that Leeloo is supposedly a supreme being, but she doesn't seem to be all that supreme. She always needs saving, in fact she's pretty useless, almost a burden. The one who always saves her and actually gets things done is Corbin, the fact that he's more capable than a supposed supreme being makes her seem pretty lame. The second thing that bothered me was the scene where they need Leeloo to stop the destruction of Earth and she asks why she should when everything that humans create is destructive. Um, what? This is a world in which human and several other alien races live together and humans are the ones getting blamed for war and destruction. That's a pretty weak argument for wiping out an entire species. Not to mention, the antagonists in most of the violent situations in this movie were the aliens themselves. This scene is probably the worst in the movie and exposes some flaws in the plot. Really, the only thing I didn't like about this movie was Leeloo's character. She could have been written so much better, though I still think Mila Jovovich did her best with the script she had to work with.

There are so many things wrong with this movie. Some bad performances (some good), bad dialog, plot holes, bad practical effects ... and some things just make no sense at all.But dispite all the flaws, it is fun to watch! For me, this is one of those movies I can watch over and over. So, I've rated it an 8, not because of its quality as a move, but based on its entertainment value.

The Fifth Element story is your basic good vs. evil theme. Every five thousand years a Great Evil appears with the sole purpose to destroy all life. The film opens on an excavation site in Egypt in 1914, a group of aliens called the Mondoshawans arrive to take the only weapon that can defeat the Great Evil the fifth element, due to the upcoming wars on Earth. The fifth element and four stones work together to create the weapon of organic life that can defeat the Great Evil. They leave a key with a priest for him to protect and pass down to each following generation and prepare them for the return of the Great Evil. In the year 2263 the Great Evil finally appears before Earth to try and destroy all life. There is a quick interaction with a battleship that introduces you to the power the Great Evil has. The next scene is when the view is introduced to Leeloo. In a Mondoshawans ship headed for earth the ship is attached by a group of outlawed shape shifting Mangalore's. The Mondoshawans ship crashes, but earth's scientists who are able to recover a portion of the fifth element and us a device to recreate it. There you seen the form of the fifth element start to take shape and you realize it is a human women and her name is Leeloo. Leeloo the perfect being is escapes the lab with a daring jump off the side of a building and falls into Korban Dalles taxi.Korban Dalles is a retired high ranking military man, who is now a divorced cab drive. When Leeloo falls into Korban's taxi he initially tries to comply with the officers who are chasing Leeloo, but gives into her pleads and a out of control fling car chase takes place where Korban Dalles outruns the law so he is able to deliver Leeloo to the Priest Vito Cornelius to help search for the four stones. From there a the crazy adventure begins, with Korban Dalles and Leeloo, with Priest Vito Cornelius in tow to search for the four stones before the Great Evil reaches Earth. The trio end up on a cruise in Fhloston Paradise to meet up with the Diva Plavalaguna who is the protector of the stones. In comes Ruby Rhod who is a outrageous radio talk show host with an explosive sexual personality. As Ruby Rhod and Korban are watch the performance of the Diva, the Mangalore's attack and kill the Diva's entourage in search of the stones to deliver back to Zorg. Zorg in turn is in turn working with the Great Evil to eliminate the only weapon that can defeat it. This is the first scene where you see the power of Leeloo the Supreme Being. With the back drop of the Diva's opera performance Leeloo enters into a raging battle with the group of Mangalore's who killed the Diva's entourage. The battle spills into the rest of the ship, where the Mangalore's try to take the ship hostage, and a bomb is set. Korban Dalles, with the help of Ruby Rhod and Cornelius wage war against the Mangalores on the ship. The battle extreme by any movie standards, but fits perfectly within the movies theme, and succeeds at elaborating the good vs. evil plot. Then a bomb is detected by the ship and there is a hilarious colorful exodus of the ship by all the passengers. With Korban rescuing Leeloo and the group departing seconds before the ship explodes. Now on their way to Egypt to activate the weapon, Leeloo learns of the ugly past of the war with the last 300 or so years of pain and suffering the human race has inflicted on one another. She loose her faith in humanity and her will to live. Once arriving in Egypt Korban, Ruby, and Cornelius frantically figure out how to activate the stones, once activated Korban places Leeloo in the center. However, the weapon has yet to activate. Korban pleads with Leeloo telling her there is much to live for, and finally confesses his love for her, which reestablishes her faith and the ultimate weapon activates and destroys the Great Evil seconds before it consumes all life on Earth. The Fifth Element is a fast pace action pack film. It's the perfect movie to watch without much thought involved. It's entertaining, and provides a number of moments where the views will be on the edge of their seat or laughing at the oddities happening with in the film.

I first watched this on video with my 2 brothers around Christmas time as a child. It has been and still is one of our most quoted movies. It didn't get the clout it deserved at the time. But I don't know many people my age that haven't seen it. It's a cult classic that needs to be on your top list!

Review title: The Fifth Element will always hold a special place in my heart
Review_body: The Fifth Element is a unique comedy, sci-fi and action film with a star-studded cast and a fun to follow storyline. With its clever editing and a cult classic feel, this movie can easily be watched again and again. The Fifth Element has a "true love will conquer all" theme following the adventures of a cab driver named Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis) after his path suddenly collides with that of a mysterious being named Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) as they fight to defend the world from ultimate evil.Throughout the film you are introduced to a wide variety of colorful characters, each with their own unique, enjoyable characteristics. Most notably, Ruby Rhod (Chris Tucker) livens up the film with a cartoonish feel that only someone like Christ Tucker could provide. Though this film is rather old now, it still retains a fresh feel with every viewing. With clever editing and the use of multiple scenes at once to tell a story in an easy-to-follow way that keeps the viewers on their toes, The Fifth Element is a very unique film that leaves you satisfied regardless of how many times you have seen it.The soundtrack and sound effects, though sometimes unrealistic, fit this film perfectly, tuning you in to the proper mood to fit the scene, every scene. Though slightly childish and sometimes predictable, this film manages to push past this slight setback by remaining light-hearted and fun to watch.Overall, The Fifth Element has been a movie I have been able to watch anytime, repeatedly, over and over. From my childhood, this film has been a personal favorite of mine that has always been there to lighten my mood, regardless of whether I'm watching it in its entirety or catching it full of commercials on TV. The cast brings it all together, and Bruce Willis gets to show off his comedy skills not commonly seen, other than in films such as The Whole Nine Yards. The Fifth Element will always hold a special place in my heart, as well as on my DVD case.

Review title: A film that after 8 years, still doesn't get boring for me.
Review_body: I remember seeing The fifth Element around a friends house December 1997. I had heard of the film and wanted to watch it at the cinema, but being 12, I was always poor, but fortunately, my friend had borrowed it from an uncle, and both being sci-fi geeks, decided to watch it.. I was absolutely blown away by the overall presentation of the film, and fell in love with it immediately. It focuses on the stereotypical sci-fi action thriller, where an evil from outer space is set to destroy the universe, and the hero(s) have to stop it. There is definitely a cult status around this film, and it still doesn't get boring for me. There are several of my favourite actors in this film, especially a very diverse villain played by Gary Oldman, an absolutely stunning heroine who in my view, started the revolution of the female hero, rather than the 'damsel in distress' that we have seen for many years, played by Milla Jovovich. and a really anti-hero like hero played by Bruce Willis. Luc Besson has directed several of my favourite films, and seeing an interview that he had during the release of the film, it seems that he had been working on the main storyline as a child. I'm glad to see that somebody could come up with one of their own ideas for a film in Hollywood, rather than releasing a very poor re-vamp of an old classic, as we have come to see nowadays. I love the effects that were used in the film, regardless of whether people say they are dated, and there is one of the best movie-score soundtracks to this film. In my opinion, an underrated classic. Watch this film!
If you thought Phantom Menace was too well written, Blade Runner was too funny, and the fist season of Doctor Who had too high of production value, this is the movie for you!

This movie starts off almost like an Indiana Jones adventure and it covers all the things that make a great movie. Egypt, Space aliens, beautiful women and action and adventure. All with a colorful cast of characters. This movie is perfect for people about 13 and up as there are some intense scenes. The characters in this movie are in some cases larger then life but you really start to notice some of the hidden gems when you watch it again. The future in this movie shows a huge blend of technology and yet many of the things that make us comfortable today. (Example, fast food, vacation spots and TV). The details in this movie are fantastic and in my humble opinion its one of the best movies ever made for pure movie fun and enjoyment.

Review title: This movie is a roller coaster of fun! Make plenty of popcorn!
Review_body: There are very few movies that are just brilliant period. This is one of them. This jigsaw of a movie has parts that fit perfectly one after another. Eric Serra's excellent soundtrack, great writing, stunning visuals and special effects and great acting make for a movie you can just sit in front of and enjoy. The casting is spot on from Willis's Korbin Dallas to Tiny Lister's President. There are so many inside jokes that you will be finding something new each time you watch it. The sheer beauty of some of the vista's the movie is set in go from gritty city to a god's eye view of a world in the background during a stage event. Two things you will take with you in your mind's eye at least: Plava Laguna's performance and the "Jewish" mother's annoying phone calls where ever Korbin goes! I love technology!
This movie is the definition of cult, enjoy.No my review is not too short.

Review title: The Best Movie of ALL Time
Review_body: I think this is the best movie I have ever seen. I love how an action packed thriller becomes a love story. I am a sucker for love stories, and action, so this particular movie hit every spot in my soul. I love the Fifth Element, I am now on the search for a supreme being to fall in love with me! Ha Ha, wouldn't that be great!

The Fifth Element will be ten years old next year, yes its true. From director Luc Besson came the awesome and absolutely stunning movie that is The Fifth Element; showing us as an audience there was still a reason worth going to the movies, and that adventure was truly alive. With a classic battle between good and evil, imortalised in the beautiful and Milla Jovovich as Leeloo, and supported by an impressive cast that included Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Chris Tucker and Ian Holm, the world of the 22nd Century came alive with aliens, hover cars and vast floating palaces, worlds and dazzling imagery. Also scored by the very talented Eric Serra (The Professional, Goldeneye), a fitting and pop-orchestral soundtrack took this movie to the next level. In a time when Hollywood is running short of movies, this movie stands as a return to classic ideals and storytelling that, perhaps, is worth saving the planet for. Check it out, and buckle up!
Convince me I'm wrong. Exactly how long do you think a movie review should be? Perfect being doesn't have fire conjuring capablity. Just one match or none of this stuff matters. Right?

Review title: Distinct characters and unusual plot makes for my new favorite movie.
Review_body: Since the first time I saw this movie years ago, it has been my favorite. I believe this stands for about 5 years now. The characteristics of the "perfect being" is enough in & of itself. Throw in Bruce Willis (yum) and a complex love-hate relationship with plenty of military red tape and you've got yourself a great movie. Unlike most save-the-world films, this plot does not resolve in an instant with a quick-fix. Characters working together run into difficulty after difficulty, most of which have a little humor thrown in but not enough to destroy the seriousness and suspense that are building. I have highly recommended this to anyone with whom I discussed good films, but have been amazed at the number of people who had never heard of it before. Go rent it now! Note- not for those who are too grown-up to leave satire unstated and just enjoy the terrific movie.

When I first saw this movie in 1997 I was mesmerized. To me everything about this movie felt prefect: the story, the cast, the scenery, the soundtrack, the costumes. It's fun with a great pace and you are never bored because you get pulled into the movie the minute it begins. The future depicted in this flick is not bleek and it's full of amusing characters so it is definitely a future I would like to live in, minus the evil aliens of course.
